Reviews.Title: “Never stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Raj U
Reviews.Content: I am a regular in best western hotels. These are good hotels for a resonable. But, Apollo musem hotel at 2 PC Hooftstraat is the most pathetic hotel that I ever came across. The receptionist spoke as if you are deaf. impolitness to the height. Then surprise surprise - the hotel's IT systems were down and I could not be given a room! I learnt that there were 4 people who were in the queue before me and that they had been waiting for 1.5 hours already! What really bothered was instead of feeling sorry about this incovenience, the service personnel spoke absolutely impolitely. Best western - you just lost a platinum card holder for life!

Reviews.Title: “It's alright”
Reviews.Author: MNRS
Reviews.Content: If you are in AMS to go to museums, this hotel is in the ideal location, but by foot, its a good walk to everything else, but I guess thats why you should jump on the tram. I first had a single room, which was just too small for my week long stay. I upgraded to a larger room, that later somehow never showed up on my final bill. Score! Truthfully, my biggest complaint was how uncomfortable the bed was. I had to ask the front desk (several times, too) for extra bedding so that I could cushion the mattress for more comfort. They are sort of front desk nazis about asking for extras. They kind of looked at me like I was hosting 10 extra people in my room althought I wasn't. And the pillows? What's up with the pillows? Their standard bed pillows are small and square. As in like couch or chair cushions. They were AWFUL to try to rest or sleep on. AWFUL. I begged for regular, normal bed pillows, but was advised the small square ones were the only ones they had. Ive travelled all over the place and have never not seen regular bed pillows used. The white and red pillows you see in the hotel's photos are what you get. Needless to say I had a very, very, very rough time trying to get comfortable in my room's bed. Spent a week sleepless in AMS. Other than that, I thought it was a good, safe hotel. They have to buzz you in after hours. The breakfast was what I expected... mainly its cold cuts and breads. For what you get, its very overpriced if you ask me. I only ate breakfast there once, its just not worth it. Go to the pretty tasty pancake place on the other side of the canal instead.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location...tiny tiny bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: MBH82
Reviews.Content: My stay at Apollo Museumhotel was very pleasant, the structure is very clean, the furniture is new, staff is polite and helpful and the location is just perfect for sightseeing. Breakfast was not included in our room so we purchased it for one of the mornings; it's quite good although I preferred the breakfast we had outside, just 2 minutes walking distance from the hotel, in a cute bar which serves delicious Dutch pancakes. If you exit the hotel, turn left, then right, cross the street and go across the bridge on the left, it's a small square on the left-hand side, along the canal. There are two bars with tables outside that are an oasis of peace in the early morning. The only negative aspect of the hotel was the size of the bathroom and the room in general. The bathroom door is made of opaque glass so you can almost see what's going on inside and privacy is quite limited. The space inside is very very small. Overall, unless it's a very long stay, I would highly recommend this hotel, which is next to the Rijksmuseum and 2 minutes away from the Van Gogh museum!

Reviews.Title: “Review of Apollo Museum Hotel, April 2012”
Reviews.Author: MELISSA NICOLE M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, great location, great staff! Thank you for making our stay so comfortable and kindly upgrading our room when we lost out on a night due to an air strike. Definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Small Room, Near to tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: xc85
Reviews.Content: The location is very near less than a 5 mins walk to the Hooberstraat stop by tram no 2 or no 5. However, there is no room service or automatic jug in the room. I've asked for plain hot water from the bar apparently you are entitled to only 1 complimentary hot water. The reception who gave me the hot water was quite rude. However, the rest of the staffs were very friendly n helpful. The room is very small. Not suitable if you have huge lugages. Overall, it is comfortable to stay if you only spend your time in the hotel for sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate hotel - but staffed by prison guards!”
Reviews.Author: El_Caudillo
Reviews.Content: Great location near the 'Golden Bend' and comfortable. Nothing special. The biggest disappointment is the attitude of the staff. In a city where hospitality towards visitors is excellent, the Best Western Appollo Museumhotel is shockingly bad. On arriving at the hotel, the receptionist behaved as if we were being booked in to a prison rather than a hotel. Abrupt to the point of rudeness, I was told to 'hurry up' filling in my form as 'other people' were waiting. An alternative would be to ensure sufficient staff were at reception to cope with demand. I noted with interest that any guests found smoking drugs in the hotel would be fined. Now I would not criticise the hotel from wishing to discourage spliff-heads but on returning to the hotel in the evening the smell pervading the corridors would suggest that this policy is not enforced.

Reviews.Title: “Don't belIeve the photos”
Reviews.Author: Christopher L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This place is a hole. We stayed on the second floor. To get there we had the option of taking the elevator that smelled of drugs or the stair well that smelled of pooh. When we got to the rooms they were the size of a Japanese prison cell. Each room was billed as a double but only contained enough linen for a single midget. Sure, it was dead in the center of Amsterdam but so are so many other hotels that you don't have to play "name that smell" in.

Reviews.Title: “Good but rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: SairBo
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great considering it's proximity to the museums and local bars. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful with advice on getting around the city. Only complaint I had was the lack of space and quality of spec. I would have expected a slightly larger room and better paint work considering it was such a well known chain. Marks over the walls spoilt the overall appearance of the room.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: konstantinos p
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in great location, just next to tram station, boat cannel stations, restaurants and plazzas. Just purchase an Amsterdam card ( for 2 days or more) and go around. The hotel itself is an avarage standard, nothing glamouruw, the rooms are small , and artificial, meaning that they are separated each other with a thin ( ultra thin )wall!! Breakfast is 2 expensive, but then again , all Amsterdam is!! If you get an offer in the room , and if location matters to you more than the stay, you can safely visit that hotel!! And do not ask for info from the frond desk ladies!!! They simply do not have an idea!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fair price, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: arsemia
Reviews.Content: We booked the Best Western ApolloMuseum Hotel, in a hurry without much information about what to expect from it. However, it turned out to be a great 2-day stay. The hotel is easily accessible using the tram line 5 from the Amsterdam central station. Also, there is a direct bus from/to the Schipol airport (fee:4â‚¬) The location of the hotel is perfect for exploring the museums. Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum are just steps away from the hotel. Also, lots of attractions are nearby the Hotel, namely the Flower Market, Leidseplein and the fabulous Heineken Experience. Our room was very satisfying. It was more spacious than we expected. Bathroom is a little small; but it was OK too. The only complaint would be about the breakfast. Not very much choices of, surprisingly cheese, and the coffee was bad. Nevertheless, there was a promotion price for the breakfast (9,95â‚¬) so it was OK, I guess. Just one last and important note: although we have prepaid the entire stay through the Best Western website, we had to pay the City Tax (about 8â‚¬ for 2 days) upon check out. This was not explicitly stated in the BW website. So, this was kind of inconvenient for us. But in general, especially compared to the price the Hotel is was very satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but less than satisfactory hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BlacklabelUK
Reviews.Content: The Location was perfect for a mix of sight seeing and night life. Close to restaurants and a short distance from trams allows you to travel easily around Amsterdam The Breakfast was adequate but that's as far as it goes. The standard continental buffet lacked any real substance compared to most hotels I have visited. The rooms were acceptable for the price we paid however the bathroom door opens virtually onto the bed which to me seemed very impractical. The bathroom door which faced the twin beds of my shared room were also made from frosted glass which led to unwanted silhouettes. During the check in process for my group we were greeted by a mountain of problems including the news that the 'complimentary breakfast' was only free for the first night. After a long debate with bemused reception staff and a equally puzzled manager the problem was finally resolved. In conclusion I would think twice before staying in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Clean but Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: nagmey
Reviews.Content: OK. So the standards rooms are small. Once you push the door to the right, taking one big step takes you to the tiny toilet on the left. Two more steps, you have the desk on the right handside, and one more step takes you to the bed. If you're staying in a double bedroom on your own, great. But walking around to the other side of the bed is going to be tricky - so my friend had to climb up the bed from the other side of the bed. Anyway. There is a nicely positioned TV installed on the wall, which was good. Towels were nice and clean, the bed was comfortable, shower was more like a 'wet room', so once you turn the tap on, the water will be pretty much everywhere. Plenty of hot water though. Also, Dove Shower Cream and Dove Shampoo were great. I regret brining my own stuff. We got fresh towels every day, which was good. Airconditioner goes up to 28 degrees, which was good enough. (It was around -14 outside, and we didn't fee a thing! So you probably won't feel cold). That's all I can say about the room. The hotel itself is in a perfect location for everything. Especially if you go for the Iamsterdam City Card - which gives you free pass to loads and loads of museums and public transport, you can take trams 2 or 5, and you'll be at Dam Square or Central Station within minutes. If you want to walk, it'll only take around 20 minutes or something - great walk on a sunny day. The hotel itself is really close to some of the museums - 1 minute away from the Rijksmuseum and 5-7 to Van Gogh museum. Lots of cafes and restaurants around. Seemed quite safe, even very late at night. Breakfast. Two words. Don't bother. OK, in Amsterdam it's difficult to find a place where you can have breakfast for less than a tenner, but at least you get what you really want. At the hotel, what you get for 10-12 (cheaper if you book it in advance, 12 if you don't) is: Slices of cake (raisin, etc.), croissant, butter, jam, sliced bread (no toaster, unfortunately, so cold bread), cold boiled egg (I got up at 9, surely they were warm at some point..), cheese slices (one or two kinds), ham-salami (2-3 kinds), some kind of chocolatey-pastry. Two kinds of cereals: 1- Kelloggs Corn Flakes 2- Fruity (the purple package - you know the one...) with cold milk and strawberry yoghurt. Concentrated orange juice, and coffee. All in all, it wasn't a disaster, but I'd rather get a pancake or something more local elsewhere. Mind you though, in Amsterdam coffee - plain, black coffee - is very expensive, and you get them in double espresso sizes - for 4-6 euros. No idea why, but it's a plus for the hotel breakfast if you fancy 3-4 cups of it in the morning like me! I stayed at Apollo for 4 nights, and I can't complain about it really. Rooms are tiny, so what. They were clean and comfortable and practical. Just once I heard the cleaner ladies in the hall hoovering the carpets at 8am which woke me up, but I guess it's my fault for being so lazy - or hungover :) That's all from me. If you have any questions about the hotel or Amsterdam city in general while it's still fresh in my head, please feel free to email me at nagmey@yahoo.com and I'll do my best to give you tips about the city :)

Reviews.Title: “Keep your belongings safe!!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren A
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Apollo Amsterdam 7-9 Feb 2012. It was only 10.30am so we didnt expect to be able to check in, however the rooms were ready which was nice. However they asked for a 100 euro deposit on the room which needs to be paid cash or card details left. This wasnt made obvious to me at the time of booking so make sure you are prepared! Rooms were clean and modern, bathroom was small but it was all we needed. We went out to explore the city leaving our valuables and some spending money in the room. Hotel is in a great spot, about a 5 minute walk to cafes/bars and restaurants. (DONT go to Madame Tussaurds, it was a huge waste of money!!) On our second morning my partner realised that the rest of our spending money was gone! We searched the room and eventually gave in going down to talk to the reception. The manager sat us down and we explained that the money had been there the day before and was now gone. The manager at first was reluctant to look on the cctv footage, and i asked him to check the card key system to see who had been into our room. According to him we were the only people to go in our room that day. (So 300 euros had got up and walked away!!) After spending far too much time in the reception already for a 2 day trip, we were told in not so many words that even if someone had been seen going in our room - we wouldn't get any money back! We were given directions to the nearest police station and left to it. (Funny the morning we checked out I looked back and the manager seemed to be hiding from us!) In all the hotel was clean and comfortable, but with a thief opperating!! Please watch your money here and use the safe in the wardrobe.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: BristolSindy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and modern, set in a brill location right near Vondelpark. We had a evening canal cruise booked with 'Amsterdam City Tours' which was situated just across the street from the hotel which was ideal! The rooms are not the biggest of rooms but are ideal if you want a clean comfortable base for exploring amsterdam! Only issue we had is that we had prepaid for the room, yet when we got there we had to pay either a 50 euro cash deposit per person, or 50 euro deposit per room on a credit/debit card. Just be sure to take a bit extra money with you for a deposit and we only had a small amount as were there for one night only, so luckily we had a debit card with us. Other than that, a great hotel and would stay there again if travelling back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “rough start, but ended well”
Reviews.Author: Theresafromnorway
Reviews.Content: Arrived here at 2.30am on Feb.3rd, extremely late due to snow chaos. Was booked and prepaid for 3 nights. On arrival was asked for â‚¬150 deposit and stood there arguing with reception staff as to why I thought this was unreasonable, especially since my room was already paid for. Was told it was hotel policy, to cover incidental expenses during my stay. Ok look, breakfast cost â‚¬12.50 (â‚¬10 if booked in advance), there was no restaurant which served lunch or dinner, and I had read on Trip Advisor that the minibars in the rooms were usually empty. So what on earth could I possibly spend â‚¬50 per day on in that hotel?! I explained that I had only brought a Visa debit card and that the deposit would come out of my account immediately, and would take 7-10 days to be refunded AFTER checkout. In the end, I was allowed to go to my room on the proviso that I appear at reception the next morning with â‚¬50 in cash. Fair enough, but I was tired, hungry and sweaty and really did not need such a long discussion at 2.30 in the morning! Next morning, there was a really nice receptionist called Anna on the desk - a whole different attitude and much more willing to find a compromise. The deposit was duly paid and, on mentioning that I hadn't slept all night due to people chatting and smoking right outside my room down in the basement, Anna immediately found me another room, still in the basement, but quieter and actually slightly larger, with 2 windows, so that at least there was some light coming in. She also arranged for me to receive breakfast ar the pre-booked rate of â‚¬10, so THANK YOU ANNA!! The rest of my stay was very enjoyable. Breakfast consisted of different types of bread, croussants, meats, cheeses, preserves, yoghurt, cereals, tea, coffee and fruit juices - perfectly adequate. The room was small, but spotlessly clean, as mentioned down in the basement, but heating was fine so I stayed warm. Tv with various channels, incl BBC news and CNN. Shower was modern, with good water pressure, basic toiletries provided. The hotel was right beside Museum Quarter, so for location it was unbeatable! Plenty of restaurants nearby - try Srikandi, an Indonesian restaurant right round the corner, great food and service in authentic surroundings. Vondelpark was a couple of minutes' walk from the hotel and Leidesplein a 5min walk. Would recommend this hotel particularly if you are in Amsterdam to visit the Museums, there are 4 of them right round the corner. Airport shuttle cost â‚¬16 and was clean and efficient, one departure every hour. A regular bus leaves from around the corner for just over â‚¬4. Good little hotel, but BE AWARE OF THE â‚¬50 DEPOSIT PER NIGHT!!!

Reviews.Title: “amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Olivia129
Reviews.Content: my friend and I stayed at this hotel at the end of January 2012, and our experience was awesome. We got there and the first room we had was small but nice, but the window was broken and it was freezing. We told them this, and they immediately moved us to a bigger and warmer room! The hotel staff was very kind, and the service was nice, overall a great place to come to at night. The area it was located in was amazing. We were able to walk to all the neighborhoods easily and the hotel itself was right next to the van gogh museum, the heineken museum and across from a bunch of boat tours. We were able to go out and appreciate the nightlife, and come back to a nice, clean friendly place. While you do have to buss and give them your room number and last name, it was almost a comfort to know that random people weren't coming in and out of the hotel. Overall it was a great experience and I will be coming back to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: travelogue78
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a good safe hotel near to the main attractions, and Apollo Hotel definetely met our needs. PROS: Helpful staff, spacious room (at least ours!), free internet at the lobby (where you can also print for free), elevator in a good condition, fridge in the room, security in the night (they don't open the door unless they confirm you are a client). It is also very close to the Van Gogh Museum, two minutes away from the Hard Rock Cafe :) and opposite the canal (where you can buy a 1.5 hour trip to the canals for 10 euros). Last, but not least, it is 15 min away from the Red Light District (don't worry it is a nice walk to explore the city). CONS: Small bathroom, extra cost for breakfast. We stayed there for 2 nights (January 2012) and I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Low cost style... but not that cheap!”
Reviews.Author: miki4
Reviews.Content: Small room and extremely small bathroom. Expected more from a 3-star hotel. Good location, near two main musea and tram stop. Slow queue to check in and out. Did not like staff behaviour, kind of rude. Having the room at 2 p.m. was late for me. No breakfast included, but available for 12.50 â‚¬ per person ( I had dinner for less in Amsterdam!). No coat hooks, I would have appreciate coming back after a rainy day... Forced-air heating system was noisy and made air far too dry. Bed was comfortable but I found some hairs in the sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: nolimitt168
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very modern and clean. I stayed here for 1 night in Jan 2012. This hotel was recently renovated in 2009 or 2010. Located 5 minutes from the Van Gogh Museum. Shower door doesnt stay closed so when you take a shower, the floor gets soaked. Other than that, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, clean, some problems.”
Reviews.Author: OkiriosAlan
Reviews.Content: Visited for 5 days at the beginning of August 2011. Good location for visiting the museums of the Museum Quarter, and a short walk to the Leidseplein (for people watching, open air live music some evenings, coffee shops and Burger King for cheap eats). We booked via Lastminute.com with room only as the only option. Six of us so breakfast bill was potentially huge. Easily the best breakfast option is at the cafe in the middle of Weteringplantsoen - like a big pavilion in the middle of a small park past the Rijksmuseum on the other side of the road. Good food, enough of it and a reasonable price; not the usual rip-off. Hotel room was small and clean. Wet room clean and modern. Good lift, smart reception area. There is a canal trip boat stop just across the road. Service was disappointing. We requested a room overlooking the street and didn't get one; apparently they cost more than we had paid. We requested a double room and didn't get one; we were assured that if we pushed the twin beds together they would not drift apart -they did and I ended up down the gap most nights. Didn't want the disruption of moving rooms so we put up with it. Bar regularly unstaffed in the evening. When we requested food in the evening we were advised to get a pizza delivered and order via reception! And the pizza menu price list we were given was actually a list of how much commission they would get for items, not how much the pizzas would cost us!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eastyorksguy
Reviews.Content: Check in quick and efficient. Single room rather small but very clean and comfortable with a super wet room. Hotel is VERY close to major museums and is in a rather select part of Amsterdam. Size of the room was not an issue as Amsterdam has too much to offer to keep you in your hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel. I would stay there again in future.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, shame about the staff.”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea T
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here over Christmas. We would not have stayed here normally as it is overpriced. but we got a deal which meant we got the room for less than half price. For the price we paid, the hotel was suitable, but if we'd paid the full amount then i would have been less satisfied with the service. Pros: The room was nice and clean and had lots of things we needed, such as soap, towels, hair drier, a safe and a desk and a TV. The cleaner replaced our towels every day and made our bed. The area is fantastic, right next to Leidseplein square, which has everything you'd want as a young person staying here, fantastic clubs, coffeeshops, bars and transport. The room was nicely decorated (I found previous reviews unfitting to my experience. Perhaps Apollo Museum Hotel has cleaned up its act since then) with plenty of modern granite, chrome and clean textiles. The bathroom was lovely and I didn't find i had any of the previously mentioned problems with the shower getting the place wet. The shower was very good and could keep a nice temperature. I had a bath twice while i was there and it was lovely. (Can you tell I'm a toilet person?) We also didn't have much problem with the frosted glass toilet doors. It's true that you don't get much privacy - you can see into the toilet. However, if you're a couple then that shouldn't really matter too much. I only seen one bug when i was there, and it looked like it might have come in the window, which was open anyway, so I think the hotel must have sorted it's ant problem out too. The room had air conditioning which you could control from your room. The hotel kindly provide you with plug converters, toothbrush/toothpaste, shampoo/conditioner combo, hand creme and shower gel (all Dove brand) and there's a few extras you can get from reception which are all detailed in the handbook in your room. I can't comment on the mini-bar, breakfast or function suites as we did not use them. Cons: The staff were pretty rude and blunt at times. On the first night we went out to ask for a converter for the wall socket and the guy at the desk was pretty out of line with us. He commented that it's always the "English" who don't bring their converters. We corrected him that we are Scottish and he replied that we were all the same (!!!!) anyway. So from then on we were very uncomfortable around the staff as we were under the impression that we were not high enough on the class scale for them (as i mentioned, we got the hotel on cheap - we would not have been able to afford it otherwise and i think that they held that against us a little). Another point I'd like to bring up here is that if the hotel is offering services such as converters, they should not mock people for needing them. Another problem i had was with the intercom at night. The hotel locks the main door at night and you have to bell the front desk and they ask you your name and room number. This would be fine if any of the staff had any compassion or manners. They leave you standing there for ages while they finish what they're doing (you can blatantly see them through the door ignoring you) and then they come to the intercom. On more than one occasion they seemed disbelieving of us when we were trying to get in. They were often blunt and asked you to repeat your name and room number many times - even though they can see you through the door and know that you have a room with them. In the mornings, the housekeeping calls in at like 9 am. LOCK YOUR BEDROOM DOOR AND USE THE "DO NOT DISTURB" SIGNS. Otherwise, in your sleepy haze, you won't hear the cleaner calling in or knocking - then they barge straight in on your naked sleeping self. Not pleasant. This may well have been my own mistake on the first night for not using our signs, but it was a pain in the neck. Sometimes the cleaner would just keep knocking the door until you answered and told them to go away. The bed was okay. The mattress was new and thick, but the pillows were pitiful. We only got one each and it wasn't the regular size of a pillow and was thin. I would have asked for a new one, but the reception were so cold to us that i just coped. The hotel did not tell us about the 150 euros deposit we should have to pay prior to our checking in. Apparently it's to cover the cost of the minibar etc, but i advise that of you don't have a credit card then pay with cash. Apparently on a debit card the 150 euros will be held by the bank for a month (The woman at reception did actually inform us of all this, i was not robbed). I paid with cash and we didn't use any of the other facilities, so i got ALMOST all of it back. Apart from city tax. Which they did not tell us anything about until they deducted it at the end - this was pretty low quality service. I wasn't bothered about paying tax - everyone should anyway - but to be kept in the dark about it until it happens. Not good. The Wi-Fi did not have adequate coverage to our room and we were right next to reception. Even with the air con on, it was very cold at night and the duvets did not cover both me and my boyfriend very well. Summary: So all in all, it was a nice hotel to stay at. The staff were pretty poor, though. The woman who checked us in was nice and helpful, but the man with the glasses was the racist one whom was cold and uninterested towards us. The other staff were all just pretty indifferent and uncaring. My advice is that if you get this place on the cheap, then do get it. Definitely. The room was lovely and the location is brilliant. Just don't expect the staff to be very hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay to see the Museums”
Reviews.Author: Kiwis_overseas
Reviews.Content: Smaller room but a lovely shower, clean and tidy. Good staff, very helpful. Easy walk to the museums, catch the 2 or 5 tram into the main station or dam square. Great eating places really close by. Get to the hotel by catching the number 197 bus from the airport, stops just outside the museum and then a very short walk (saves heaps on transport costs) - ask for the complimentary coffee tray.

Reviews.Title: “One year later...”
Reviews.Author: nychic026
Reviews.Content: One year later and I'm back at the Apollo Museum Hotel. I knew I wanted to come back because I had a comfortable albeit tight stay in my room. And plus I knew it was in a quiet location, but extremely close to all the spots. And it's only a five minute walk from the 2 and 5 tram (which to me seem like major lines). This time I had a different room and the configuration was different. Last time I was on the 4th floor and as everyone has mentioned before the room was very small. This time I had a room on the 3rd floor. The bed and bathroom was configured differently and it made all the difference in the world. The room was still small, but "much" bigger than last year. This time there was room to place suitcases around the bed and there was a little more space. Also this time around the shower head was placed in a way that the water would not spill out. Last year it was a nightmare with the shower because the water would just spill out all over the floor and onto the carpet of the actual room. This time it was much better. Only once did the cleaning staff forget to leave us towels. But a call to the front desk and a few minutes later we had towels. Breakfast was included in our package and it served us well. There were a variety of meats, cheeses, cereals, breads, and fruits. Standard, but hearty if you eat up. It seemed the reception staff were much nicer this time around then last year. They weren't mean at all, but had the Dutch demeanor. However, this time they were friendly and helpful. I said it last year that I would stay here again and I'll say it again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Levon M
Reviews.Content: I gad read a number of reviews complaining about the room size, service etc. The rooms were not large by American standards but were normal for European standards. If you want large spacious rooms then book a Marriott or something comparable. But you must expect to pay a great deal more. I have traveled all over Europe for business & personal reasons for over 15 years and I think this hotel is as good or better then any I have stayed at in their price range. We arrived there at about 9AM from a US flight and were expecting to have to store our bags and come back later to check in. To my surprise the desk clerk said our room was one of the first of the day to be cleaned and would be ready in 15 min. We sat down & had a cup of coffee and in about 5 min he came & got us and we were in the roon 5 min later. We asked for recommendations for restaurants within a short walking distance and they gave us a list of 3 that were no more then 3 blocks away - all on the same street at less then a block apart. We ate in 2 of them the 2 nights we stayed there before getting on our river cruise boat and they both had outstanding food and were cheap even by American standards. I read complaints about how tight the bathrooms were - but since the shower door opened inward there was more then enough room. For a good hotel in Amsterdam - you can't beat this one. We will gladly stay there in time we are in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: casey6fox
Reviews.Content: The room was small. VERY SMALL even for Europe. We however spent very little time in the room. I loved the neighborhood, and it was very easy to navigate the city as there was a tram stop not far at all from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MRD105
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews on Trip Advisor, I was more than a little concerned that I had booked this hotel. My concerns were completely unfounded, all the staff very friendly and really helpful, yes the room was a little on the small side, but that is not unusual for Amsterdam. The room had everything in it you would want, including flat screen cable TV, hairdryer and free wifi.. It was really clean and made up and cleaned daily. The bathroom was very modern, well lit and there was lots of hot water. The hotel is in a great location situated close to The Rijksmuseum and The Van Gogh Museum, there are lots of great restaurants and bars close by and canal opposite were you can go on a canal cruise. If you get the train from the Airport to Central Station it is cheap and simple to get on the 2 or 5 tram and it will take you right to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bex0000
Reviews.Content: Went in December 2011, the room was quite small but serviceable. I only have a few complaints, the cleanliness of the room could be better (there was dust in the bathroom, carpet looked like it could have done with hovering), free tea and coffee was awkward to get, you had to request it from the bar, also when the machine was given it was dirty so attention to detail not so good. Towels were plentiful if very cheap and rough. Long waits at the bar. Staff a little stand offish.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Amsterdam, November 2011”
Reviews.Author: The_Bs_of_2007
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable, we had a corner room which was very spacious compared to other twin/double rooms. Great view over the canal. Convenient for trams. Internet was free to use but didn't work all the time. Staff friendly, service good. Complimentary toiletries, shower was hot.

Reviews.Title: “Proverbial cat”
Reviews.Author: Colm K
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in hotels for most of my life and I found the museum hotel in Amsterdam by far the worst one I ever had the misfortune to stay in.The facade is imposing and the staff are friendly but 100 euro per night for such a tiny room with no tea/coffee making facilities,no fridge and the room is so small that the t.v. had to be hung up near the cieling,so straining one's neck to watch it.I have itchy feet and have stayed in homeless hostels which would put this hovel to shame.I almost forgot.I had to give a very hefty deposit and pay anything from 2.80 euro to 6.80 a day city tax.I don't know what the deposit was for as there was absolutely nothing worth stealing and the towels were like sandpaper.

Reviews.Title: “Too many problems in only 3 days - in a this hotel downtown Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Tudor B
Reviews.Content: 1. I have arrived, together with a group of my colleagues , on 30.10.11 - around 8:30PM. Our reservations were prepared since 2-3months in advanced - by our company's travel agency. The check in forms were mixed (containing first name of one person and last name of other person) and a lot of typing errors. The receptionist observed these errors and he confirmed that he will correct - we have completed the rest of the information on the form eg: (passport number, etc) and we have gave also the credit card to be registered into the hotel's system. 2. Internet connection was not working on 1.11.11 - around 22:50 - i have complained to the reception and the clerk said - that it's not a problem with the connection but with my computer. I have tried to use one of the computers near the reception and the internet was not working. I have contested again to the receptionist which came to check and he realized that it's a real problem, saying "Sometimes it's happening during night" and i asked for a resolution, he replied, â€œNo problem..." and he disappeared...i was astonished....and at 23:00 i saw the guy leaving home as his shift was over... 3. On 02.11.11 - i have arrived back to the hotel at 23:15 - i took a bottle of water from the fridge - and i have asked Ms Tamara- to charge it on my room (226) - she tried to do this but she told me that it's not possible as the room is booked on another name...i was blocked...how was that possible having in mind that i stayed in room 226 for 2 nights. She raised her voice and started to be very arrogant - saying that â€œI am smartâ€� and she cannot charge a bottle of water on some other person's room...and she was trying to convince me that 226 is not the room where i am staying. After i gave her the access card of my room - she discovered, looking also in some papers, that the room was initially booked for another colleague of mine who cancelled the reservation as she was not able to come anymore â€“ so the receptionist from day 1 when we have arrived did not correct the information into the hotelâ€™s system. At the end Ms. Tamara realized that is a system error and she modified the information in the system but not before asking my ID and without any apologies. 4. Even the hotel is rated 4* the rooms are dirty and need urgent repainting of the walls. One of my colleagues who was staying at -1 found some ants in her bed sheets and the room had bed smelling â€“ probably from humidity. All these facts - should raise important questions to the management of the hotel which should really improve the training level of the personnel from the front desk . There is absolute no customer focus shown and more that this some of the hotel's employees are arrogant.. I will advise the travel agency working with our company to avoid making more reservations to Apollo Museum Hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised this was Best Western”
Reviews.Author: sardonicDublin
Reviews.Content: Booking on-line we were happy that Best Western would be reliable. This hotel was not up to any expectations. On arrival, reception lady was polite enough, but the night manager, when our third colleague booked in, was downright unhelpful and rude. The booking was made by credit card from our office but because the lead person was not carrying that same credit card there were all sorts of complications. Rooms were adequate although my mattress tried to tip me out on the floor a couple of times! Rather dark, winding corridors did not inpsire confidence as there were some fairly iffy looking characters in the lobby. Confusion over whether breakfast included or not. As taxi waited, they tried to charge for an extra person who didn't exist and were not about to listen. Reception was appalling. Definitely not again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has a bug problem”
Reviews.Author: PinkyB1969
Reviews.Content: I am staying here at the Apollo Museum Hotel and there are bugs crawling all around my room. I came to the front desk to ask the gentleman Gerco for help and he said there's nothing they can do until morning. The mattress is lumpy and the room is dirty. The front desk is of no help! The room is so small and dirty I feel like I am in jail not on vacation. I paid for a room through hotels.com and I will never prepay for a room again because you're stuck once you pay with bad accomadations. How is anyone supposed to sleep with bugs. Not to mention what I might take home with me!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price, there are better hotels in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: PinkyB69
Reviews.Content: I checked in on November 20, 2011 at 11:00 PM. The lady at the front desk was less than polite. I questioned the request for an additional 150 euro on top of my pre-paid room price and was told the hotel didin't know if I would steal or damage something. I told her that I had previously stayed at The Best Western Blue Square and had no problems, and she told me too bad. I explained to her that after 3 weeks traveling through Europe I hadn't set aside an additional 150 euro. In the end she told me either pay 50 euro or I can't sleep here. After paying the additional rate, I make it to my room only to discover the room was dusty, with cracks all over the walls. The room is no bigger than a small walk in closet and the pictures on the hotel website don't depict such a tiny dirty room. In fact the room is small I was able to clean it with the Lysol I carry with me in my travel bag. The mattress slopes and my back is all but aching. I am so miserable in this crappy hotel; especially knowing there were better options for the same price. Furthermore, this place is located in a good location but not worth the headache of staying in the crappy palace. Ad an American who travels a lot for leisure, I wouldn't recommend this place to an enemy!

Reviews.Title: “Worked for me”
Reviews.Author: pommemacintosh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Apollo Museum Hotel at least four times for business throughout the year. Rooms and bathrooms were clean; free wi-fi was extremely helpful. Staff was courteous, attentive, and spoke fluent English. I used breakfast cafe when my travel schedule permitted and appreciated the variety of breakfast choices. The hotel has a shuttle service from and to the airport. I did my own booking through the hotel's web site. The only thing I wished for was a luggage (baggage) ramp. The hotel entrance has steep staircase and no ramp for handicap access or carrying heavy travel bags up the stairs. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: 108George_D_11
Reviews.Content: Arrived to find that we had been put in rooms on 4th floor. These were very small and already looking tired. Asked for a move and was told that we had already received an "upgrade". Unbelievable response. Was eventually moved to rooms on 2nd floor. Reasonably sized. As we had payed the full rate for the rooms I felt a little cheated by the original rooms allocated. Hotel information in the room states that tea & coffee facilities available and to call reception. Was told by Front Desk that I had to collect drinks from hotel looby bar - hotel staff would not deliver to the room. After a disagreement with the barmaid who tried to sell me two cups of coffee @ â‚¬7 was given a kettle, two cups and two sachets of coffee on a tray to take upstairs. Hardly the service one expects from a customer focussed organisation and supplies were not re-stocked. Also agree with earlier comments about frosted bathroom doors and bathroom sizes. Finally, believe Front Desk and Bar staff would benefit from refresher training on handling customers.

Reviews.Title: “I'm writing this review for my mom who doesn't use the internet”
Reviews.Author: CarmenSandiego83
Reviews.Content: My mom just checked out of Apollo Museum Hotel. She was with Gate 1 travel on their tour of several cities in Europe. My mother is in her 60s and doesn't use the internet so I am writing this for her based on her comments about this hotel. My mom would wholeheartedly NOT recommend this hotel, especially for older travelers looking for quality and comfort. She said the first person to check her in was nice but that the next person at the front desk was rude so it was kind of a mixed bag in terms of service quality. The walls in the rooms are very thin. She said she could hear everything from conversations to phones ringing. She said the breakfast was just boiled eggs and fruit. She was hoping there would be at least scrambled eggs or something filling like a continental breakfast. So don't expect the breakfast at this hotel to fill you up for the day. However, the thing she disliked most about this hotel were the rooms. She said her single room was so small it felt claustrophobic. She didn't have a good night's rest at this hotel and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “dont take the rooms in the dungeon”
Reviews.Author: COJO1
Reviews.Content: we arrived at 9pm and were given the card to our room and told it was downstairs.never accept one of these rooms.on opening the door we were met with an overpowering sewerage smell which on opening the bathroom glass door it was worse the smell was vile.luckily my partner is 6ft so he could open the window but only after standing on the bed to be able to reach.obviously you cant leave windows open at night as rooms are below pavement level.the rooms are cramped you get a folding suitcase rack but the only place to put it is infront of the wardrobe,not practical.though hotel is in a good location.we couldnt stay in the room and went to reception and asked for a change ,the staff didnt seem surprised we had asked but said they were full that night but we could move the next day.they kept their word and did move us to a higher room which was atleast 4 times bigger and no smell but still a pain moving as only there for 4 days.hotel seems to cater for lots of school parties.i dont get the frosted bathroom doors i suppose ok if you are a couple but i would of felt uncomfortable if with a friend.although frosted you can see everything so not much privacy.staff friendly but hotel not really worth writing home about.

Reviews.Title: “Location May not Suite Others”
Reviews.Author: mrcool76
Reviews.Content: Spend 3 nights in October at this Hotel. Firstly I found the staff very helpful upon arrival. When I checked in and went to my room I found it quite small and hardly any light entering the room. I went back and asked them if I could change the room. They were very accommodating and they showed me various rooms until I was satisfied. The room I had was yes small but it was clean, warm and comfortable. Canâ€™t complain here. The location is close to museums, and public transport. But if youâ€™re the type of person(s) who prefers everything at your doorstep (like, bars, fast-food, supermarkets etc) then this may not be the right place to stay. But then again others may not mind. Centraal Station is about 15-20 mins away from the hotel via tram. Also if you are coming from the station lâ€™d advised not to take a Taxi, as Amsterdam has a complex road system. The taxi will have to make some sort of a de-tour to get to the hotel. Tram 16 or 32 will take you to this hotel. I would stay at this hotel if i had to choose in future.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION BUT.........”
Reviews.Author: giovanna24
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a very nice location, close to plenty of museums, restaurants, bars and public transport. However the rooms, especially the bathroom are not as clean as they look! The bathroom is of a very smart and modern design however it was laden with dirt and dust. This was very promenant around the shower area and bath where cleaning had obviously been neglected. The main bedrooms are very small and with basic facilities, there was no tea/coffee facilities (although I believe you can ask for some), a adequately sized television is provided but this has a rather bright LED light on it that you cannot turn off, bit of a pain during the night! The hotel advertises a 24hr bar and dining area... Food is apparently only available in the evenings 2 days a week and the choice of menu is more or less a range of glorified party snacks. And if you want a drink, thats a whole different story.... I think the average waiting time for someone to turn up to serve you at the bar is about 20-30mins, then after someone finally turns up it turns out it's most likely the same person that checks you in.... Brings back memories of Fawlty Towers! Overall the best thing about the hotel is its location, okay for just a room but nothing special. P.S. Breakfast is 12.50 euros, however they sometimes reduce this to about 10 euros if bokked in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Only share a room if you're close friends or family”
Reviews.Author: mantaqueen
Reviews.Content: You can't complain about the location of this hotel - a tram station nearby (maybe 10-15 mins from Central Station), right around the corner from Rijksmuseum and within walking distance from the hustle and bustle of Leidseplein but still tucked away from the nightlife so you can enjoy a good night's sleep. If you can cope with the narrow beds and the cramped space of the hotel room, that is... We had booked a room with twin beds, but the room was so small, the beds were put together (there wasn't space enough to have two separate beds...) The bathroom was clean and pretty modern, but as tiny as the bathroom of a cheap cruiseship cabin, no way to fit two people in there. The shower flooded the floor, make sure to put a towel there. The faucet looked pretty cool but it was impossible to wash your face properly (not designed by a woman, obviously) The worst part was the frosted glass door, there was virtually no privacy so only stay here if you are close friends or family. The staff at the hotel were generally quite indifferent. The main door is locked at night, in order to get in you need to ring the door bell and talk to the receptionist. This procedure was never handled with good service, we felt mistreated every night, never like valued guests. It was like talking to a prison guard! Only one receptionist had the courtesy to great us with a brief "good night" upon entering the hotel. The staff needs training, for sure. Also, dont forget to put out the "do not disturb"-sign, if you don't want housekeeping to enter at around 9AM. We booked this hotel at a bargain rate, so we were okay with staying there. The location is indeed excellent, but the hotel doesn't have much else to offer in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice in many ways, but not for handicap travelers”
Reviews.Author: Jack B
Reviews.Content: The Hotel looked great. It is centrally located. The street is the "Rodeo Drive" of Amsterdam. But it is not a good hotel for those with mobility problems. My wife uses a mobility scooter. We had been told the hotel was accessible. When we arrived we discovered she had to sit on the sidewalk while I went inside. She had to come and go through a freight elevator that was not designed for people. It was dangerous and demeaning. Lots of pluses for this hotel, but it would have been impossible for my wife (despite being advertised as accessible) if I had not been with her. Very disappointing. We won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kelstress
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location on a street with a lot of high end shopping and close to lots of affordable restaurants and other attractions. It was within walking distance of the Bolls and Heineken factory. The staff was friendly, the breakfast was good, and the rooms were clean. Great location for touring Amsterdam and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the solo traveller”
Reviews.Author: Vijay2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights a few weeks ago when I was in Amsterdam alone. The room was small but fine for just me. The only thing is that the water leaked all over the floor when I had a shower and it was quite noisy in the morning due to garbage trucks outside (I have no idea what they were doing)! There is a TV with lots of channels in English and the staff were nice and there was free internet access as well. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance and on the tram route of most things you'd want to see and the price was quite reasonable as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - one of the better Best Westerns”
Reviews.Author: farrahmu
Reviews.Content: One of the more modern Best Westerns, the Apollo Museum Hotel is in a great location for young travellers who are looking for a good time. Close to a buzzing nightlife but far enough so that you can get a good night sleep. Staff at front desk were OK - more needed, that's for sure as the Concierge was doubling as the bar man and receptionist which is annoying when you just want to check in. Rooms were small but thrifty and clean. Modern bathrooms and facilities. Internet really only worked in the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel: just a little out of the centre, close to tram, bus & canal routes.”
Reviews.Author: Zappier
Reviews.Content: Had a great time; staff friendly & helpful. Clean. Rooms are minimally furnished. Just far enough out of the centre to not hear the nightlife. Right next to the Rembrandt Museum and a very short walk to the Van Gogh Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cf333
Reviews.Content: This hotel was above our budget for our recent trip but anything cheaper in Amsterdam seemed to have bad reviews. The hotel was nice and clean. Room was smallish but ok for a few nights stay. Found the staff at reception rushed and it was difficult to have an uninterrupted conversation with them. Would stay there again though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: vadnu
Reviews.Content: The Apollo Museum Hotel is quite nice and conveniently located in downtown Amsterdam. The rooms are small but renovated and of a good clean standard, but the walls seem rather thin. I had a room towards the corner of the street, and I must admit that the noise from outside traffic bugged me. There is a surcharge for breakfast, which you get a discount if you order the day before. However, I don't think it was worth the money, and you might just want to find a nice cafÃ© to get some breakfast at instead.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: rmshelby
Reviews.Content: This hotel was maybe the loudest hotel we've ever stayed in. The walls are paper thin and you can hear everything from the rooms next door and the hallways at all hours of the night and early mornning. We stayed there over a weekend and on Friday night, the hotel was hosting a private party in the lobby bar until midnight. We could hear the club-style music pounding until almost 1AM and we were one floor down from the lobby where the party was being held. When I called the lobby at 12:30 AM to complain about the noise and to remind them that their signs in the lobby said the party ended at midnight. The woman at the front desk apologized and said she was tired of the loud music too, but did nothing and the party contunued. On Saturday before leaving the hotel for the day, we asked the front desk if they would mind calling a resaturant for us to make a dinner reservation. He agreed to do so until I told him the name of the restaurant and he said he didn't think they had any availability so he wasn't going to call them. When I called the restaurant myself, we got a table. Really bad service on the part of the front desk. My husband and I were so happy to leave this hotel! For the money we spent on this place, it would've been nice to be able to sleep even a little.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny”
Reviews.Author: Marcashton
Reviews.Content: Dont stay on the ground floor. I had the room right by reception and it was noisy all night. Lorries arrive early with deliveries which was also disturbing. Bathroom door hardly opened because of the bed, which was so soft or worn out that I could feel the wood below. Not a very good few night stay especially when I was paying â‚¬175 a night !

Reviews.Title: “great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Akash K
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel made up for its shortcomings. The pushed together double bed and tiny bathrooms were a bit disappointing but seeing as we spent very little time indoors we got over it. The room itself was clean and the bathroom, though small, has everything you need. The personnel was helpful though they seemed to be understaffed at times. Breakfast needs to be booked in advance which I found a bit odd but you can still show up unannounced-you need only to pay slightly more. The tram is close, you're on a very chic block with plenty of shopping. Be sure to try Indonesian food, there are two great places within a stone's throw of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs, no wifi, oh my!”
Reviews.Author: Trq084
Reviews.Content: Initially impressed with the hotel, looked great and amazing location. Room had air con on upon arrival so it was nice and cool. Room was small but expected and appeared fine. Went out for a Saturday night only to wake up on Sunday morning to bed bugs crawling all over me. I collected about ten in a container, packed up my things and went down to reception. She seemed genuinely embarrassed and moved me to the largest room in the hotel. Spoke to other guests who had ants in their room as well. The wifi was broken for about 40% of the time but there was an engineer there the last day fixing the problem so hopefully they have fixed the problems. Had the hotel not been located in such a great location, I would have demanded to move hotels on Sunday morning.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: PackRat08
Reviews.Content: So to start it is a very basic Best Western Hotel so expect that. There is a bed, a table a safe and an closet and one piece of art on the wall and a tv with basic channels but it does have wifi for free. You can upgrade to a better room if you so wish to for a fee. The bathrooms are small but everything you need is there just a little tight to move around in. The staff are very helpful and are very nice and you can leave your luggage there if your room isn't ready. The hotel is walking distance to museums and to the Heineken Experience and walking distance to the main core with restaurants, shopping, flower market and so on. It's such a lovely place that you'll want to be out and about anyways!

Reviews.Title: “Average at best, saved by location!”
Reviews.Author: Dreams90
Reviews.Content: Just back from three nights in the Best Western Apollo. First impressions of the hotel were good, nice building, nice location, two minutes from the tram stop and modern lobby. Check-in time is 2pm and we arrived bang on time, however there was only one person on reception checking a lot of people in. We waited until about half 2 to finally check-in and were told (after a few minutes of being blatantly ignored) that our room was still not ready as the hotel was 'fully booked'. Waited until three to finally get our room and we were disgusted by it. It was beyond tiny, as soon as you open the door you smack it against a clothes rail, which had to be placed that close to the door as there was virtually no floor space in the room. There was about a foot of space around the bed, with a tiny window overlooking the back of another building. Our double bed was also not a double bed, but two singles pushed together. However the worst thing about the room was the walls. The supposedly white walls were covered in black marks from suitcases, shoes etc. Even the wall above the bed was filthy. It was disgusting. We stayed about five minutes then went back down to complain. The girl on reception was quite nice and changed our room immediately (fully booked?). Our new room was not in the main hotel building but in a separate apartment building beside it. She assured us that it would be nice and quieter in this building. This room was much bigger and much cleaner with huge windows. However it was on the ground floor and the windows did nothing to keep out the noise from the rather busy street outside. The double bed was again two singles pushed together, which would have been ok had they not been made up separately, not exactly nice when you get stuck in the gap between the beds and have to sleep beneath separate single duvets! The pillows were also tiny, and very high, resulting in a terrible crick in the neck! This all combined to give me a terrible night's sleep every night! Another room's bathroom also backed onto ours and so the noise from the flush would be enough to wake anyone up. We were also beside the main door into the building which was noisy when people were coming in and out. The bathroom was ok, wasn't a fan of the glass door, or the fact that the shower practically flooded the little room, making the tiles a deathtrap if you didn't put a towel down. Our room had a minibar however it was empty. There was also no room service provided by the hotel, at least not to our room, and when my other half went to the main reception to inquire about it (at about 12) he found the front doors locked, and received no answer to the bell. We didn't get breakfast so can't comment on it, and spent little time in the main hotel building unless we had to, however the staff on check-out were helpful and polite and we were allowed store our bags for the day too. The best part of the hotel is undoubtedly the location, on a high-end shopping street, 5 minutes from the main museum district, 5 minutes from Leidesplein (full of bars and restaurants), 15 minutes walk to the Anne Frank museum, 20 minutes (max) to the Red-Light District. Overall I was not enamoured by the hotel, I don't think I would recommend it for anything bar the location.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we paid a little extra!”
Reviews.Author: stevegreen59
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms for a 3 night break and decided that we would upgrade 1 of them to 'Executive' standard. This turned out to be a good idea as the other of our booked rooms, a twin room, was tiny and my daughter and her friend struggled to get around the room with their suitcases!. Book the breakfast when you arrive to save money as this gets you a considerable discount. All in all the hotel was very clean and tidy, the staff were very helpful and the breakfast buffet was excellent. There is a large luggage store where you can leave bags if you need to. Rijksmuseum is 100 metres away, Trams are close by at the Rijksmuseum or Liedersplein.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel - Mid-rate price”
Reviews.Author: 999MRT
Reviews.Content: Disorganised reception. Online pictures flatter to deceive. NO minibar or tea and coffee facility despite being advertised as standard. Can be obtained on request (you have to complain to be told this.) If you are nthere more than 1 night the coffee, creamer will not be replenished - you have to get more from the bar. Be prepared to wash your own cups - clearly not part of the service ! Best avoided if you can afford 10 - 15 euros more.

Reviews.Title: “We were double-booked”
Reviews.Author: Roland M
Reviews.Content: Despite emailing the hotel the day before to inform them of our late arrival, when we turned up at 10.30pm we were informed that the hotel was full. To be fair, they did arrange accommodation in the 4-star Wyndham Apollo and a taxi transfer at no extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “we very much liked it - and would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: annabelle0710
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, the service was good. Our room neighbours were noisy a couple of nights out of our 4 day stay was very good. We were at the very top of the hotel - the bed was up very high.....you just needed to double check before you got off the bed!! The hotel is well placed for the museums and other attractions. We had a place to visit each day - local bars and cafes were great too. Breakfast was good at the hotel too. The bathroom was always clean which I am very particular about - I would have no hesitation staying at this hotel again. Near to the trams - communication was easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great trip!”
Reviews.Author: NYY_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is walking distance to practically every tram/bus that travels throughout the city. It's also about a 2 minute walk to Vondel Park and a 15 minute walk to the Van Gogh and Heineken brewery. The daily complimentary breakfasts (which were part of our package) were pretty decent. The chocolate and butter croissants were made right on the premises adn they were delicious! We had a large room without much of a view. Other guests we met there reported having a good view overlooking one of the canals but it was a tight fit between the bed, dressers and bathroom. The bathroom door is a frosted glass so be aware that you can see quite a bit of what the person is doing on the other side. Make sure you ar sharing the room with someone you are quite comfotable with as a result of this. Amsterdam is a wonderful city with its beautiful canals, architecture, and museums. We spent 5 days there which was a sufficient amount of time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fxhero
Reviews.Content: We booked online and liked the central location and price. Checking in we realised we had stayed there before and that they had modernised in the meantime. Very modern looking. The standard rooms are basic and pretty small, quite crowded with the furniture. We upgraded to a bigger room which had exactly the same furniture in a much larger space, very strange. My wife hated the bed lamps in our first room, they were pretty useless. My main complaints are about the night staff, it was not very nice to leave us standing on the street with a baby while they faff around. If you want a mini-bar, talk to the staff, not all rooms have them.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotels in Amsterdam.. definitely worth it”
Reviews.Author: stephaniekroll21
Reviews.Content: I may be biased because this hotel upgraded our room right when we checked in. The room itself was extremely spacious but the bathroom was pathetically small like all the reviews say. Honestly though its in a great location and its much bigger than anywhere in the residential areas of Amsterdam because those buildings are all tall and skinny with steep staircases. The stuff in there was really nice, I slept like a baby here. Its a tad on the expensive side but worth it for at least one night. Parking is expensive in the city so watch out for that. Overall had a really good time here. Computers in the lobby, free wifi. Breakfast is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: agsena
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend had just finished his PhD at Princeton this summer when we decided on a four country European getaway. We had a great time in Berlin and Paris and were equally excited about Amsterdam. The city was WONDERFUL, this hotel was horrendous. We are barely greeted, when we have difficulties using the WiFi (which we were told would work in our rooms (and didn't)), they could hardly care less! Telling me that they needed more people reporting a problem although, he said, most people with Apple products had complained of not being able to log on (???). I guess there were not enough Apple users including myself to have this gentlemen try to restart the router.... We get to our room which smells disgustingly like mold. Another minor detail, our hotel window faced a large wooden panel - super depressing. Fortunately, thanks to another review, we had been warned that the shower leaks out from under the useless glass door, which does not even come close to holding out any water from running out onto the floor of the bathroom. We put a towel here when we showered. The first night/morning we are awoken by an alarm at 3am. My boyfriend and I are unsure whether it's a fire alarm and open our door and see nothing nor here any movements from others. We fall back asleep. I ask the person at the front desk the next morning whether it was, in fact, a fire alarm and she nonchalantly answers "yes." I inform her that the protocol in US hotels is quite different, and the louder alarms remind everyone to evacuate their rooms- she replies "well we expected you to come out and gather by the lobby." I don't even know what to say. The people at the front desk seriously could care less about us. Lastly, upon returning home, I realize I've been charged an additional fee outside the $560+ USD I dropped for three nights. I've been charged an additional $43 USD (not including the currency convergence charge). I call the hotel, and explain to them that THEY had explained to me all my charges on ONE, single, bill that I thought had already been paid (including a short phone call I had made from the room). They say that my rooms were paid separately, by another authorization number, and that the additional fees (17EUROS for a "tourist tax") and my phone call were charged separately. Why not explain this on check out? I have now had to pay TWO separate currency convergence fees!!! Dealing with this hotel AGAIN when I got home was incredibly infuriating and when I tried to explain what I had thought was the way I would be charged to the man at the front desk of the Best Western Apollo MuseumHotel Amsterdam City Center HUNG UP ON ME. I strongly, strongly, advise you look elsewhere when booking your hotel in Amsterdam. The Best Western Apollo MuseumHotel Amsterdam City Center was the absolute WORST experience of our entire trip. Best, Angela

Reviews.Title: “all design no substance”
Reviews.Author: allenexeter
Reviews.Content: Good location and comfortable but the bathroom was poor, all glass shower which leaked like a sieve, and what spark decided a glass door was a good idea on the entrance, when you have the light on all is revealed..breakfast was a bit steep at 10 euros each plus a whopping 7.55 city tax...so nearly Â£30 for 2 of us..Staff were very good and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast overlooing Rijksmuseun”
Reviews.Author: sussexray
Reviews.Content: Reception was excellent allowed to check in early however room was next door to lift which could be very busy. Everytime it stopped at floor the lift made a ringing sound.Asked to change and was moved to fourth floor. Room was very small-just bed no chair. Shower was also small and difficult to get in and out of. Small windows but if you are just stopping overnight and just want the bed it was okay. Breakfast in the morning was excellent and overlooking The Rijksmusem and if you booked breakfast night before you had a 3 euro discount.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tonic55
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about this hotel, staff friendly, rooms clean,good location, as previously said on other reviews you do have to provide your credit card details for a deposit for your room. The only thing here is if you get a taxi back to the hotel make sure the taxi driver knows the full address as they will take you to Apollo Land 5 minutes away and then when you tell them its wrong the get very aggressive this happened twice to us we couldn't believe it TWICE!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a city break, in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MartinSpoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week whilst on holiday, and whilst I wouldn't call it especially memorable, but for the price range it was more than adequate for our needs, and ticks all the important hotel boxes, such as clean bed and clean bathroom. Rooms are small, as is typical of many hotels in centres of old European cities, but as we were in Amsterdam to explore the city, this wasn't a problem - as we were only after a place to sleep. You can tell the hotel has been renovated in the past few years, and the shower room was particularly nice as a result of that. My girlfriend was unconvinced by the frosted glass door between the shower room and the bedroom at first, but it wasn't a problem! There were some marks on the walls that were probably the result of bags being brought in and out - it meant the room didn't look spotless, but it wasn't a problem - overall, very clean and tidy. The A/C was easy to use (and effective), and the safe in the room was appreciated. Free WiFi is in the hotel, though reception seems to vary depending on where you are in the hotel, but there are also two PCs in the reception that are free to use, along with a printer (also free). We did have a problem when we arrived, as we were given a twin instead of a double. After going back to the reception to complain, the member of staff did change our room, but only after about 10 minutes of him clicking away at his computer, saying he'd "have to move things around". He'd do well to remember who the paying guests were. The location is excellent - a taxi from centraal station is about 15 Euros, but the tram goes within a minutes walk and is quick and easy (just hop on and ask for a 1 hour ticket). It was great for the museums, and we enjoyed walking into the centre of the old city. We did breakfast on the first day and it was fine, but we decided to go and find different places to eat the other days.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: rainstr
Reviews.Content: Very well located in the museum quarter, quiet, clean and nice streets. The restaurants are around the corner. However it is far away from the railway station and a bit pricy (because of the area, 120 eur per night I paid). The hotel is clean and fresh, the staff is friendly, the rooms is virtually new, extremely clean, but a bit small for two persons. There is a free safe and internet. Breakfast was at an extra cost, it was reasonable, but it did not include anything warm. If you are a business traveler who wants to visit the museums in the evening without loosing time for getting there, this is a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: clairecass
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - excellent for the price. Reception is great - free internet access and very friendly staff. The rooms are nice, clean and crisp. A little small but no problem for a 2-4 night stay, we didn't mind. Lovely views from rooms, big shower and massive bathroom. TV even has BBC etc which is nice. We really enjoyed our stay. The location is brilliant, everywhere notable is walkable and there are plenty of restaurants and bars close by. Very much recommend it. Obviously this is not 5 star luxury but if your on a budget its unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay - and a REALLY comfy bed!!”
Reviews.Author: MediWyn
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasant stay in the Best Western - a room a little small, but perfect for a short stay. Shower was lovely and powerful, and the bed was VERY comfy!!!! Had 2 very good night sleeps!!! VERY pleasant and helpful staff - would consider staying again for a return trip - Perfect for couples for a few nights

Reviews.Title: “just area is good”
Reviews.Author: ktktkt97
Reviews.Content: it is so bad experience in my whole life. some staffs Kim, Floor are so rude to customer. Floor was angry with us when we ask to get some hot water. and KIm did not keep our promise and she was laughing when i complain about hotel service and she suddenly stop to listen. I was so upset and angry about bad service during staying in there. Iâ€™m gonna write review about this all review site even if it wil takes long times. and i think it is kind of racial discrimination.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location and clean,modern facilities”
Reviews.Author: cellista
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights on a citybreak with my mum.We found the room perfectly acceptable for a short stay.it was small,but not unduly so.The bathroom was fine,compact,good shower(took a while to work out the hot/cold function,but good water pressure, and clean).Comfy beds,good flatscreen TV,room v quiet(though the fact that the hotel was not full may have been a factor!)Near tramstops and canal.Major art museums and posh shopping v close. Only gripes:twin beds too narrow and close together,though comfortable in themselves.Got used to this! No tea and coffee in the room(thought I had seen this advertised as a feature on websites).However,Amsterdam does great coffee,tea etc,so was not really an issue,just that I am used to hotels of this calibre providing it. No bar/cafe in the lobby.Breakfast is extra,we didn't bother,seemed overpriced.A number of nice places within a few minutes walk for breakfast anyway,and so near the tram to not be an issue.Helpful and friendly staff. I'd go back for a similar trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: Homergruven
Reviews.Content: This hotel is across the street from the Ryks Museum.. Canal Trips are great!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and good value for money, clean & modern”
Reviews.Author: simoncallaghan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located close to the tram network, and only a short walk from Leidseplein which is one of the main areas for night-life and entertainment. As you had a 5 min walk from the hotel to Leideplein you were not at all disturbed as the hotel is in a well light area which is nice and quiet in the evening. The reception area is small, and you can queue if large groups check in - but just come back later if it's nothing urgent. You can pre-book your breakfast the night before, and then you'll get a discount although we didn't have the breakfast so I can't comment on what it was like. There is free WiFi in all the rooms, and also free internet access via 2 computers in the reception area. They also have a free printer should you need to make use of it! The rooms are modern, and spacious. They are clean and well maintained. Our room as a triple, with nice large windows overlooking a small private square at the back of the hotel. The rooms also have a safe, flatscreen TV and mini-bar (this is an automatic charge, so you can't use it for your own stuff!) There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room - but this is common across many continental European hotels. The bathroom is clean, modern, with a hairdryer and plenty of 'Dove' soap, body wash and shampoo. The door to the bathroom is frosted glass, so comments regarding privacy from others are valid - you can hear people in the bathroom and make out shadows behind the frosting - but if you're with a partner or close friends it isn't an issue. It certainly wasn't for us.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: crooman
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny-I mean really tiny-like 16'by 8' including the so called bathroom. The pillows were-well look at the photos-you couldnt sleep comfortably on them. The breakfast was-shall I say barely adequate-.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Clean”
Reviews.Author: TruthSeeker_123
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. I highly recomend it for family with kids of all ages. It is centrally located and allowed us to return if needed to get some rest, the tram i just 1 block away. There isn't alot of 'family friendly' food places close by, but there are some places just a short tram ride away. the room was comfortable and clean, the showers are wet rooms not bathrooms, so just make sure you dont keep anything in there. The breakfast was nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AmericanBarby
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my 17 year old son and we spent a week in Amsterdam. The room was larger than rooms I have had in Paris, Nice and London and the price was much better. The location is close to the museum district and an easy walk to the trams. We didn't mind the twin beds so close to each other as we were so tired from exploring the city we fell asleep easily! The bathroom had a frosted glass door so there was little privacy for any noise- I recommend running the faucet for privacy.
