The shower got water all over the floor until I put the bath mat against it. Despite the bathroom issues I would recommend the hotel and I would stay there again. The breakfast was the same every morning but the food was very good quality and enough variety. Our breakfast was included with the room rate which was a pleasant surprise to me. I think it may have been because we booked a "deluxe" room. The website for the hotel indicated there are refrigerators in every room. We did not have one but we did have an easy to use electronic safe. We traveled to Amsterdam from the U.S. I printed a map before traveling and had a little trouble finding the hotel from the tram stop. It is actually quite easy and if you email the hotel in advance of your trip they should be able to send you written instructions. The only instructions I found on the website are for driving. There are computers with a printer in the lobby if you need to access the internet and print anything. I used them to print train tickets for a day-trip to Belgium and to print our return boarding pass.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kiara_Colon9
Reviews.Content: After about seven people cancelled last minute for a weekend in Amsterdam, I ended up sharing a room with a couple for two nights at the hotel, for a total cost of 280 euro. First, the bad. The bathroom setup was weird, because the whole floor got soaked when an individual showered (no separation between shower and bathroom area). Also, the internet was horrendous for the most part, so I wouldn't stay here for a long-term stay. And the biggest problem that we had was that our room was FREEZING! Our room was located underground on the -1 floor, it was under freezing temperatures outside, and the heat did not work. While the staff provided us extra blankets and gave us a stand-alone heater, we did not pay 280 to freeze for two nights. They said they would check on it the first night, but the problem in our room was not resolved by the time we left. This is the reason why I gave it a 3/5. Now, the good. Since the couple shared a double bed and I had a separate bed, the room was very spacious. The hotel was very nice and very cheap considering the location of the hotel. As soon as we walked out the door, the Hard Rock Cafe was literally across the street, along with clubs, museums, and a 24/7 spot to eat. Prime location for tourists (which I was). Friendly staff, good breakfast, and a clean room. Overall, I would stay here again, as long as the heat works and my stay isn't over a weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and location!”
Reviews.Author: BSenter
Reviews.Content: Apollo Museum Hotel is a Best Western property very well situated in the Museum District of Amsterdam. The staff, especially Marlic, were very helpful with services and directions to the places we had on our list. We, 2 seniors who had been on a plane all night from Asia, were allowed into our room early which was a welcomed surprise. The area is perfect for museum goers with the Rijks and Van Gogh right there. Also, the Leidseplein, with many small ethnic restaurants, large Vondel Park, and the fab Cuyps street market and canal rides are all close by. The rooms are small, but comfy, and the kind staff and location make up for the room size. Our only negative experience was being pick pocketed in Dam Sq., a common occurrence there, but the hotel staff graciously helped me make calls to the credit card companies in the States. Great location and kind staff make for a good stay at Apollo Museum Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with unexpected visitors.”
Reviews.Author: Lloyd84
Reviews.Content: The below comments regarding this hotel, rooms and bathrooms are very accurate. The rooms are very small, even though we arrived in off season and got a little larger room. The customer service is not great, the free internet tends to drop out quite often and the breakfast left a little to be desired. When we first arrived we noticed two or three people complaining at the front desk regarding the key cards not opening their rooms they had just checked into. While our key worked we did not think much of this until the last night. While having a quite evening in watching movie the door suddenly opened and a strange man walk right into our room. After apologizing he then left, not a great experience. When I contacted reception the assured me it was not their error and they had not provided anyone else with our room key. As their was a random guy with access to our room it made for a restless sleep. While I hope this was only a one off occurrence I will ensure next time we visit Amsterdam I will not be staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the twins - beds are extremely narrow”
Reviews.Author: Lisacha
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a twin room with my mother and the beds were ridiculously narrow. It was the smallest kind of double bed, simply divided in two. And the beds were standing right next to each other. The room was so small it was impossible to place them in any other way. So it was basically like sharing a narrow double bed with a small gap in the middle. When I laid down on my back, I could just about fit on the bed. A well built man would have his arms dangling over the edges. It was hard to get good sleep and we woke each other up poking the other person in the eye... Another inconvenience was the glass door to the toilet. It didn't even cover the entire opening. So when one of us went to the toilet, we were literally sitting facing the bed. The glass was frosted but not enough. Everything was visible. And entirely audible. Only stay in a twin here if you want some kind of team building experience with someone you want to know -everything- about... I would've been fine with this if we had paid 60-70 euro, but we had paid nearly 150 and that price is just ridiculous for what you get. But the free wifi was great!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal museum location!”
Reviews.Author: StaceyP21
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband booked the hotel via fab website laterooms for a 3 night stay and booked at bargain price of â‚¬75 per night. When we got there, we had to leave our credit card details or pay a â‚¬50 per night hotel deposit guarantee, which we did not know about. This was the only major fault and niggle about the holiday - if I hadn't brought my "emergency credit card" we wouldn't have had any spending money. Our room was fine, other users have commented on size, but I don't agree - problem with showers is true though, but I just put a towel on floor and it was fine. Great to have dove shampoo and shower wash too, instead of those tiny hotel complimentary ones! Amsterdam is expensive though as a whole, and watch out for the death traps I mean bikes... They're everywhere. No one pays attention to the green man either so be wary when crossing the roads.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: michellebee009
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights and it had everything we needed and more. The front desk staff was very accommodating and our room was huge and exceeded our expectations given the price we paid. The location is great, it is very close to museums and right next to the canal. The only downside were the washrooms, the frosted door didn't offer much privacy. I could see silhouettes of my boyfriend while he was in there haha...Make sure you're VERY comfortable with the person you are sharing a room with as it can be awkward.

Reviews.Title: “A nice ending to out European getaway”
Reviews.Author: lorarenae
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel. We had just come from Paris and spent at least 50 more euros on that dump of a room. The Apollo Museumhotel was clean, modern and perfectly convenient. Breakfast was included and was very enjoyable. The staff was pleasant and the rooms were spotless! This was by far the nicest hotel we stayed at in Europe. We are already planning our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, superb location”
Reviews.Author: GeerardRotterdam
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located in an excellent location, near Paradiso concert hall and walking distance from Leidseplein, and at the end of the PC (high end shopping street). The hotel itself is plain good, nothing fancy, but excellent priced. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Yes it's small, but I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: nychic026
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Apollo Museum Hotel for 2 nights 3 days. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk to two trams around the corner (the 2 and the 5 which both come and go to Centraal Station). Surprisingly there is no ramp to go into the hotel. Rather you have to climb about 10 steps with your luggage into the hotel. We were immediately able to check in. They asked for a credit card to keep on file (which I thought was weird because the room was paid for). Nevertheless they made a "copy" of it (more about this later - it's not bad I promise). We were on the 4th floor and the elevator is big enough to fit two people with two 25" inch suitcases and a few stragglers. To comment about the smell that the reviewer below mentioned - I think it was from the carpet. There was a mildew-y musk in the hallways that is certainly not refreshing but I think it stemmed from all the wet shoes coming in and out of the hotel (It had unseasonably been snowing for the past few days). That said our room did not smell at all. If anything they sprayed something to make the room smell fresh upon entering. The room is small! A lot of reviewers have mentioned that and it's very small! We kept our suitcases by the door and we had to squeeze to get in. I can't imagine two large size people comfortably staying in this room. However, if you plan on just using the room to sleep at night then you should be just fine. The bathroom - while it looks pretty it's not exactly functional. The sink is pretty, but ours didn't drain very fast because the water would stay around for a while. Not a big deal - we stuck the end of our toothpaste tube under the drain (if that's what you call it) and the water went down a lot faster. We left it like that for housekeeping to see and they fixed it. They include large size Dove shampoo/conditioner and body wash in the shower and by the sink. The shower isn't very functional as well. If you take a long shower - good luck. The way the shower is installed it's on the same level as the sink and toilet. There's no step into the shower. So if the water doesn't drain right away it leaks out into the bathroom. After each shower we would use over towels to mop up the floor. It wasn't that big of a deal when given we had hot water and good water (not hard, not soft). It was kind of cold in the room and we couldn't figure out if the heating was on. But from reading the previous review it seemed there was a hotel wide issue. We put on the highest temperature we could but it was still cold. Not a big deal when we went under the covers - which honestly was weird that there was only a comforter and not a blanket. Usually in hotels there's a decorative blanket/quilt, a textured blanket and another linen. Here there was only the comforter, but I have to say was cozy and warm. The bed has a foam bed then the mattress so you kind of sink into it. But it was comfortable. I must say I did fall asleep fast. Our room was in the back so no issues with noise. I did notice there's a fifth floor and it's stairs only access - so good luck if you have heavy luggage. Breakfast was included in our package. And it was good - there were croissants, rolls, toast, apples, and oranges, cold meats ham, turkey, salami), cheeses, cereals, yogurts, coffee, hot chocolate, juices, etc. After you sit down you get asked to fill out a form with your name and room info - I guess for either stats or to see if breakfast is included in your package. Onto the credit card - there's free wifi in the hotel which is a plus. I saw two computers hooked up to a printer for guest use which is always nice. Since it was the end of the trip I wanted to make catch up on bills and banking. I noticed there was a charge for the hotel (about 130USD). I wondered for what since the room was paid for and it couldn't have been a deposit. "Oh no it was that stupid sink!" I thought. When we checked out I asked about it and they said it's just security measure/deposit, but that it would be credited back to my account. It wasn't a big deal as I had enough in my checking and several days later the charge disappeared and all was well in my checking account. I would recommend if you're checking into the hotel to make sure you have enough money in your account for their "charge". Because it would be terrible if you were "charged" and you didn't have enough money and you were given an over charge penalty. All in all, yes it was small, but the room was clean and tidy and in a great location. You're about a 10-15 minute walk to Leidesplein and about a 40-60 minute walk to the Anne Frank House. Given the location (you're around the corner from the Rijksmuseum, and nearby the Van Gogh Museum, and the Stedelijk museum). I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “location good-hotel not so..”
Reviews.Author: Kirscha
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 5 days on the recommendation of a travel agent. The staff were nice, breakfast was good. We didnt reserve the full 5 days in the beginning and almost moved, but it was so much easier to stay. (My friend is handicapped) The place has a smell about it and yes is small. Make sure you book ahead of time on a (UK or mainland websites) as the rates can vary alot and go WAY up on the weekends. It is right next to the museums and across from an canal cruises(do first). All in all I would recommend you look elsewhere. Amsterdam is soo easy to get around in-trams, bus, canalbus, etc! The Jordan area is full of local flavor and very central also- I will look there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Rooms, Bad Customer Service... But Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 2010WorldTravel2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Apollo Museum (Best Western) Hotel for two nights. What was supposed to be an exciting kick-off to a wonderful trip in Amsterdam unfortunately culminated into a very frustrating experience. PROS 1. Superb location. If you dare stay here, you will be walking distance from Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum -- two "must sees" while in Amsterdam. The hotel is also walking distance from several public transportation stops. 2. The hotel was clean. CONS 1. My room (for two) was so small it was ridiculous! When I walked approximately two feet from the door, I ran into the bed. Please note I am not exaggerating. Further, to get a medium sized piece of luggage to the twin bed near the window, you need to lift the luggage over the bed. The floor space is inefficient to pull your luggage around the bed. 2. The designer of the hotel's bathroom clearly never used it! While granite floors are aesthetically pleasing, they are also incredibly slippery. Additionally, the shower floors did not slope toward they drain nor did they have a barrier so that water would stay in the shower. Therefore, after a 5-10 minute shower, water was all over the (slippery granite) floor. 3. The hotel does not have a full restaurant. It does offer a buffet restaurant with a mediocre selection. 4. During our last night, we did not have heat! Mind you, during our stay, Western Europe experienced record low temperatures for November; so indoor heat was crucial. When we reported there was a heating problem, the front desk's response was, "There is nothing I can do. This is a management problem." The lack of heating was a problem throughout the hotel and the front desk did not even bother to call the hotel's technician.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staying at Apollo Museum Hotel”
Reviews.Author: afx242
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Apollo Museum Hotel for four nights. I traveled alone so i ordered the single room with breakfast via my traveling agent. Hotel was very nice. I read few horrible reviews here before i got there, but i found a nice, quite and comfortable hotel. Yes, room was a little bit small but but hardly as described. I saw in my life smaller rooms for higher prices in places like London or New-York. Location was just perfect, very close to the museums area and few minutes walk from main shopping and nightlife streets. there was also a bus stop in a minute walk to Dam square and central station. Staff was very nice and helpful too. Breakfast was no more than nice but pretty fine by me. If my package would not included it, don't know if i had payed on it. There are better offers in the cafe's near by. I had a fine time in Apollo Museum Hotel, and will consider staying there again on my next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_AnnMaree
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, found the hotel to be in an excellent location. Within walking distance to the major sights, restaurants, shops, pubs. Hotel itself was very clean, requested and were given a room on the 4th floor, nice view. Room was perfectly adequate for a city break, no not the biggest room in the world but absolutely fine for two adults. Breakfast not included in the room rate and we found it to be quite expensive for continental breakfast - 76 euros for two people for four mornings, including discount! Hotel staff pleasant and helpful when required.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: kbuck18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights and it was a decent place. Good location, easy to catch the train and next to the Van Gogh museum. Make sure and pack conditioner for your hair if you are used to hotels having shampoo and conditioner.

Reviews.Title: “free wifi - great location - perfect for visiting A'dam”
Reviews.Author: artcenterbabe
Reviews.Content: checked in on 8/12/10 afternoon and checked out on 8/13/10 - Great location! Located right on Museumplein which is less than five minutes walk to Rijkmuseum, Van Gough..etc - I booked it through Expedia(plus their promotion), the total was $99.02 including tax which is pretty good for one night. They charged you for a small amount of tax when you check out, I forgot the total, it was probably around $5 or less. - the room was tiny (I'm from New York, so the room pretty small consider NY standard) but clean, cute, just enough for me. I was out most the time so it was the perfect place for me to go back shower and sleep - The bathroom is also small but awesome. Great use of space and my first time using European designed shower...pretty impressive - Free wifi in the whole hotel! The other hotel I stayed during rest of my trip only had limited(30 min) free wifi in the lobby. That's whenever I'm close by Museumplein, I'd go back to Apollo's lobby to check my email on my phone real quick x - the only thing bugged me was that there was a weird smell by my bed but I was too scared and tired to look under the bed or open up the drawers to find out. Plus I pretty much passed out right when I got back from a day of fun in A'dam! x - no complementary breakfast :(

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but lackluster room”
Reviews.Author: travelbugNY_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights with a friend and the hotel served its purpose as a place to stay, but It was quite overrated. The location is great; it is safe, within walking distance of the canals and pretty much everything else, especially the museums. The area isn't hopping in terms of nightlife or cafes or eateries, but as I said, you can walk to all that, including the tram. It is located off of a very high-end shopping district and rather close ton Vondelpark. The lobby is also very nice - quite modern and welcoming, with computer stations. However, the rooms are anything but that. At least the room that we had. The decor is a mere afterthought. It was very clinical. Plain white walls with no artwork of any kind. The room is also very very small. Just to get to my side of bed I had to practically squeeze my way through the wall and the bed. Perhaps most of hotels are small at this price point, but I can't say as this was my first visit to Amsterdam. I wouldn't have minded the size of the room, if it had been decorated to a better degree. I would stay here only really if you want to be close to the museums and don't mind a lackluster room.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here even if it was free”
Reviews.Author: Jennyfer2
Reviews.Content: We chose the Best Western Apollo hotel as we presumed it would be similar, in standards, to the chain of hotels they own. We arrived in Amsterdam as part of our trip around Europe. We had great expectations for the hotel seeing as how we had stayed in the Best Western hotel in Lile a few nights prior and could not have rated the hotel highly enough. However this hotel was the worst we stayed in during our travels, which was surprising considering we stayed in Paris, which is renowned for its miniture rooms. One thing which the hotel fail to mention is that they do not accept Maestro cards. As we did not have a credit card we had to pay up front and also give a cash deposit of fifty euro for every night we were staying. Seeing as how this was the last leg of our travels, money was tight. Had I of known this prior to our arrival I could have budgeted for this. The staff were unhelpful and seemed only to smile when there was money involved. The room was like a cell complete with two tiny windows and and a bathroom with a toilet facing a frosted door. The cleanliness of the room was not ideal and there was a terrible smell in the bathroom from prior guests who obviously were not sufficently cleaned up after. It was difficult navigating the tiny bathroom alone especially after a shower when it flooded. It was also hard to enquire about anything at reception as there was usually a que of dissatisfied guests every time you went to reception. Needless to say the atmosphere was not inviting. The only positive about the hotel is its location, however, when you are faced with torrential rain and wind, which we were, you find yourself wishing you had a room you could bear to stay in. I booked this hotel at a reduced rate, however, upon reflection I would not stay here again even if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “A Terrible Mistake choosing Apollo Museum Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Francescogala
Reviews.Content: I was in The Apollo Museum in Amsterdam with my wife for 2 days,upon arrival they gave Us an ambeliavable small,stinking room on the first floor were 2 luggages and 2 people couldnt stay in as it was really small .After complaining (on the front people are not polite as they look they give You a favor ) they gave Us another room at the first floor after waiting 3 Hours and was not much different from the previous one.Mabe we made a mistake to had paid it in advance,paid not a small price over 200 Pounds.When we left unfortunately we forgot an Ipod charger cable,We called at the hotel plus we sent 2 mails on the last 15 days but they didnt care or show Up,we didnt have Idea of the rooms could be so small and such a bad customer service.We do travel a lot around the world and this one was one of the worst hotel we ever been. Sincerely, F.Gala

Reviews.Title: “A good find”
Reviews.Author: RoosterNEScotland
Reviews.Content: Booked through internet and narrowed down to Best Western. Near Museum and the expensive shops but it was very good value. Recently refurbished, lobby is also part of the dining room that has uninspiring furniture but works in the space. Good reception, lots of smiles and really good value. Room was good but highly polished bathroom floor was slippery when wet until I put a towel down. Seemed to be a lot of young people staying but it was quiet, close to the posh shops and museum and park. Liked the place and would use it again as it was very good value. Free wi fi which is as it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtrav3l
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, we were immediatly pleased with the hotel services as we were given an upgrade to a deluxe room. The room is small but very nice and chic and the bathroom is modern. They even had the whole bottle of dove liquid hand soap, body wash cream and shampoo unlike other hotels that give you a tiny bit of soap and small shampoo bottle. The location is perfectly situated in the museumplein district, the rijksmuseum is just on the right side of the hotel, literally can be seen from the hotel window. The tram is also behind the hotel (in front of the rijksmuseum) and it was very convenient even if we have luggages since on our last day we had to take a train to paris and we took the tram to the central station. The food every morning is good although I would like to have more selection of cheese and coffee but other than that, it was good and filling! The dining area is big enough to accomodate hotel guests for the breakfast and it wasn't crowded at all. The only downside is the lighting since they use dimmed lights and its hard to apply make up every morning but overall, the hotel was well worth it and I enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “good location, clean and refurbished hotel, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Leon08
Reviews.Content: Located just around the corner from the Ledisplein and the Vondelpark, it is central without being surrounded by clubs/bars. Our room was newly refurbished, and although on the small side (most are in Amsterdam) it was super clean and perfectly acceptable. My only critism is that for the price i would expect breakfast included, which is an additional 12.50 euros. I would recommend this hotel to a friend and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy mornings”
Reviews.Author: nlstudent
Reviews.Content: Every morning, starting around 8 AM the staff on our floor (-1) would start moving stuff, talking loudly, whistling, and overall making so much noise to wake us up. The room was also rather small (too small for 2 people). Wireless internet in the room was very poor and barely functional.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms unfriendly for family and terrible entrance for luggage”
Reviews.Author: Samlko
Reviews.Content: I'm staying for five nights as I booked from central station for 500 euros without tax. The main receptionist lady was pretty angry after I requested for a room upgrade as it was too small no fridge and we could not open our suitcases. She asked for 25 euros per day and the upgrade also did not have a fridge. Feeling a rip off I refused and asked for furniture to be removed. She again refused. I just asked for the table and chair as the bathroom is inside the room. I asked her to come and tell me where to put my suitcase. She later said yes and we could open our luggage. Avoid if you can we could not as it was high season and I wanted a room as I was traveling with a child.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: chimpychew
Reviews.Content: The hotels location is spot on, right next to the museumplein and canal and one minutes walk from the Vondelpark and Holland Casino. A couple of minutes away is the Leidseplein. Tram stop round the corner with frequently running trams both towards Centraal Station and also Amsterdam Zuid. Yes rooms are quite small but you're in Amsterdam! Chances are you won't be staying in your room much. Also they are really nicely finished with a great power shower. The reception/bar area was very nice and there was a TV showing all the World Cup games. Staff were really nice and helpful. We did get this on late rooms and so were only paying 80 euros a night which for THIS in Amsterdam is absolutely amazing. Some places didn't even have a toilet in the room for that. If I could get it at this price again - and a bit more, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very fine hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mangeldamine
Reviews.Content: I was traveling throught Europe with my partner, visiting Amsterdam and spending one night on my way. There is absolutely nothing I would like to complain about in terms of room, cleanliness. THe shower was small, but worth admiring, because it was all marble and shiny clean. Overall the room we had was pretty small, but we didnt really mind. Bed was comfy and clean. There was some construction going on in front of a hotel. But our windows were facing the inner side, so we didnt hear anything. We were travellling by car, the parking area in nearby locations is very limited. We didnt take breakfasts, because just 5 minutes walk away there is a nice cafe with better prices.

Reviews.Title: “Never, ever, ever again! Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kat040
Reviews.Content: First I should stress I come from a post-communist country so my standards aren't exactly overdemanding - but this hotel is just unspeakable - mostly because you choke with outrage and rage (especially if you already paid). I organized a trip for my work colleagues - and I just couldn't stop blushing from start to finish. Horrible smelly, dirty, small rooms with bathrooms that look like out of a drug dealer's den in the seventies. Half of the rooms werenÂ¨t even in the same building - a fact I was most definitely not told about - but a bit down the road - WITH NO LIFT, only a dark poky staircase and an entrance that would shake the resolve of the most hardened Romanian veteran. In some of the rooms, the floors were actually concave! And all this adorned with ongoing renovations, i.e. dust, noise, you name it. Truly, truly disgusting experience and to this day - three years later, I'm unspeakably angry at the hotel and at the way they fooled us with pretty pretty pictures on the internet. Yuck!

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: mkennedy38
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a 4 day stay in Amsterdam. The hotel is centrally located on the canal. Vondel Park, the Rijksmuseum, the Stedelijk museum, the old city center, and the Van Gogh museum are within walking distance. Check in was horrible. My room was not ready until after 1600. This reservation had been booked 60 days in advance. I got no apology for the delay. I arrived at the hotel at 1315. I filled in my check in paper work (passport number, address, phone number). When I returned at 1500 to go to my room, no one at the desk could located the original paper with my personal information on it. No one was able to assist me up the stairs with my luggage. Even though they were to have a porter service. They allowed me to leave my luggage in a room on the ground floor since I could not check in. When I went to retrieve it, I found that it had been tossed and buried under other luggage. The room was small but perfect for a single traveler. The room was neat tidy, and well stocked. Scheduled wake up calls were at the least 10 minutes late. The staff was mediocre and acted as if other customers were a burden. There is a bar downstairs that did not have anyone working in it for the whole time we were there. The desk staff would walk over and prepare a drink according to the request. The hotel is a short walk to the tram station. The train station is not far from the hotel either. It is also located on one of the canals. It is in walking distance to the downtown area. Check out was fast, because I had charged nothing. Also, the hotel offers free Wi-Fi. Noise was kept at a minimum.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: rtf_2000
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with friendly staff. We visited this hotel after a very bad experience in some apartments in Amsterdam and were delighted by our room. It was great value for money booked last minute (â‚¬70 for a twin room) and had a good sized room and shower room. It was also very clean and quiet so good all round.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel nice and modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kerz_yeah
Reviews.Content: we had to book this hotel last minute as our hotel we booked , over booked!!! we went into reception and the lady let us us the computer and printer to book as it was cheaper to do online- FAB !! We were very happy with our room and the beds were soooooo comfy the bathroom was tiny but perfect (didnt need to be any bigger)lovely shower (big head) Also free shower gel and shampoo (Dove dispensers) so dont take shampoo or showel gel(always full up ). I must say you can hear a little noise like the people upstairs if walking around but it isnt anything to moan about . The lobby is very modern with funky lighting and vases, the receptionists are very helpful let us borrow convertor plugs and let us leave lugguage. GOOD STAY AND CLOSE TO HARD ROCK CAFE, LEIDSEPLEIN, MUSEUMS.

Reviews.Title: “a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: smart1979
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights. The room, (at the ground floor near reception desk) was quite clean and very small but this was not a problem as it was used just for sleeping and showering. The staff was friendly and helpful in case of need. Location is excellent: walking distance to everything you would like to see in Amsterdam. Breakfast was not included in our booking and it was very expensive (â‚¬ 17). In short a good balance between price and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and well furbished hotel”
Reviews.Author: Short-Haul-Traveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel was convenient for centre but out of the hustle bustle of the centre. Right next to major museums and convenient for trams. 20 minutes walk to centre through shops and picturesque canal sides. Good restaurants nearby (in opposite direction to centre) Rooms VERY small but newly and nicely done out. Bathroom tiny but very well presented and new. Breakfast was 12 euros but 3 euros cheaper if booked day before and although continental, was worth it when compared with cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the hotel ads”
Reviews.Author: BlackWidow69
Reviews.Content: On a trip to Amsterdam on a freezing week-end it came as a bit of a shock to realise that the "comfortable and spacious" room I had booked was a claustrophobic cupboard with a lethal bathroom basin. This hotel is splendidly situated near the museums and is clean with pleasant staff but the many drawbacks mean I could not recommend it unless you are just looking for a fast overnight stop. The twin room we had bore such little resemblance to the photograph on line that I would say it is misleading, The entire 4th floor is in the roof of the hotel and the small rooms have even smaller, high windows that make them very claustrophobic. The bathroom, while very modern and nicely done had one major, dangerous design flaw - the water spout over the basin projects so far that you risk putting your eye out when you try and rinse your face. If you are short-sighted, as both I and my friend are, this is very dangerous indeed. All of this is a pity because the location is superb and the staff is friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new quiet and good”
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a quiet location but walkable to all the sights of Amsterdam. The Leidesplein are is only a 5 mins walk where a good variety of bars and restaurants can be found. The hotel has recently been renovated with everything being nice and new, however the rooms and the bathroom are very small. Having paid only 50 pounds a night it was definately good value for money. 2 Computer including a printer to be used free of charge in the lobby. Wifi apparently free, too.

Reviews.Title: “I think some people were in a different hotel”
Reviews.Author: tgb44
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend in a,sterdam and stayed at this hotel. We arrived at 10 a.m and could immediately get into our room. Although it was a little small it was clean and well positioned, overlooking the canal. It is very well situated for public transport and getting to places of interest by bus or tram but out the the noise of the city centre. When we checked out at 9 in the morning we could leave our luggage at the hotel while we continued or exploration of Amsterdam before our evening flight. We enjoyed our stay and would certainly stay there again. I think some of the negative reviewers were stating at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mid week value - weekend rip off”
Reviews.Author: luckyse7en
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel a quite few times, the rooms differ between, brand new, and old. If you plan to stay here, ask for a renovated room. All rooms are no-smoking, and the hotel still being worked on by laborers. POSITIVES + Bathrooms maybe small, but nice + free WIFI internet (although can be patchy when hotel is busy) + Large Dove shampoo, shower gel dispensers + Location is central + Staff nice, but seem a little overworked + Mid-week rates can be very good value + 2 lifts NEGATIVES - The weekend hike in rates is truly appalling - there 2 hotels (one next door called the Park or the far better, NH central, that offer way better value for money. - Single beds are lumpy (even the new mattresses) - Rooms in both single, and double can be small - No coffee machine, kettle - The lobby needs renovating -- worn white leather seats - Restaurant area seems redundant - â‚¬3.50 for coffee is a joke - The entrance has a fair few steps to lobby - New bathrooms are prone to flooding TIPS + I wouldn't pay more than â‚¬100, for a double. There's simply superior places elsewhere + Advance payment is about â‚¬10 cheaper - If you're just walking in the hotel to book a room, you can ask for this rate, they normally don't offer it to you out of hand, even when you do pay up front. + Basement rooms are generally, because of the early morning delivery of new laundry. + Directions: Tram 5 from Centraal Station. One stop after Leidseplein. CONCLUSION It's a mixed bag, but it can offer you great value in the week day rates, but weekend or high season, I know there are much better hotels elsewhere in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “room dirty”
Reviews.Author: kinemagustavi
Reviews.Content: the hotel is modern, well located and well connected. we asked to change our bed linen because we found it dirty and the staff told us that they could do it but they never did it.(we staied there 3 days only because we already paid ). breakfast very very expensive for the same money you can have a dinner in good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Heva5
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner choose this hotel because of its close proximity to the rijks museam and leidseplein and because it was a Best Western we thought it would be a better standard. The hotel room we stayed in was small and basic. I would have liked to have tea and coffee aming facilities, especially as we had opted not to have the over priced breakfast. The first room we stayed in in the hoel had a blocked plug in the shower, which we didn't realise and the whole hotel room flooded in at least an inch of water, ruining anything that was on the floor (suitcase, shoes etc!). We were realocatted but the next room was just as poor quality as the tap came away from the wall when you turned it on full power and leaked. Maybe we just had bad luck!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but dire, expensive hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Florins
Reviews.Content: The only positive for this hotel was itâ€™s location- it is very close to the Rijksmuseum- but that doesnâ€™t make up for itâ€™s extortionate price (â‚¬220 for the first night and â‚¬100 for the secondâ€¦.even though the website showed â‚¬110 for a superior room) and poor quality. A few of the issues: The hotel is undergoing renovation, which I wasnâ€™t warned about when I booked, and the noise associated with it started at 6am. Thankfully, they donâ€™t appear to work on weekends, or it wouldâ€™ve ruined my Sunday morning. There were also piles of building materials along the corridor, and no â€œapologies for our appearanceâ€� signs. I had a renovated superior room, which was a good size, but it seemed shoddy that they could only offer plastic beakers and fixed dispensers for soap and shampoo. It all felt a bit sparse and hostel like. As noted in other reviews, the bathroom was miniscule. The bed was extremely uncomfortable- I could feel the springs in the mattress!! On the first night, I felt very cold, and was unable to get the room temperature up using the heating controls. When I called the front desk to ask for a blanket, I was told that they had all been given out. The lady said that I could have one the following night, but thatâ€™s not very helpfulâ€¦â€¦and it didnâ€™t turn up then either!! The breakfast buffet was good, but at â‚¬17, very overpriced. Luckily, I was told that if I booked it the night before, I could have it for â‚¬12.50. I couldn't eat in the restaurant on the night I arrived as they only allowed groups to use it....not very helpful for a solo traveller. There was only one member of staff on the front desk during the evening, so checking in or asking questions took a long time. In summary, donâ€™t assume that quality and value are behind this Best Western- you will find far better places to stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam with the Ho Ho Ho Fifty up "Lads" @ Best Western”
Reviews.Author: Peewee123
Reviews.Content: This review is short & sweet. Hotel & staff Functional. Bar Service Good. Nice Bar Area. Here with 7 older lads for Birthday weekend & one of us running in Marathon(which goes past Hotel). I feel if we hadnt had such a good time(great City Amsterdam) we would have noticed the shortcomings more! Basically 100 euros per night twin room.Tiny rooms & tinier cupboard like shower room. Shower good.No Tea/Coffee in Room. Beds Comfy.Breakfast expensive. Room cleaning average. Handy for the Canal Bus, but fair way from centre.But fine with us.Taxi back from Red Light district expensive in early hours 15 euros but will try & charge more.Lots of smiles & no change offered until I refused to get out! On check out another 16 euros city tax per room! Naughty! why isnt this up front?? who gets it?? All in all...ok. but the hotel could do better & possibly so could you.But Amsterdam ,something for everyone. Avoid the Irish Bars expensive! Lots of cheaper Bars & Clubs.American Comedy Store Midnight Impro ...poor. Canal Bus a must!

Reviews.Title: “best by far”
Reviews.Author: gbs2009id
Reviews.Content: i an in the hospitality industry , i own properties in florida and turst me i know what is expected by our guests . from what i saw of this hotel it was renovated and awesome and anyone that had any problem with this place will never be satisfied as far as im concerned . yes the bathrooms a little small but we in usa are use to BIG and that the way we live but we gotta to remmeber that we are visiting in another country and hence they circumstances are differant to ours in the usa . anyoen witl even a little sence can see that in amsterdam the shops are small , the peoples offices and thier homes are small , the apartments are small but THIER HEARTS are BIG . how can we expect hoteliers to provide facilities that we are used to in usa considering that they have limited space etcetc . i mean you dont hear people from europe coming to usa and complaing that our hotels are too big etc etc they accept what is .. is , and we should too. in addition i have first helped by a lady called bakker .. very pleasent and helpful , 20 minutes i had a few questions and i was helped by a gengleman called louise and again they both were very professional , infact whiel iwas waiting for louise , he was helpinga couple and an irate lady who messed up reservation kept interupting him and he tried to explain to her that she had made an error in her reservation and he showed her the reservation and as soon as he is done with this couple he will help her but this irate lady kept on and on .. he appplogised to the couple and helped clam this irate lady , helped this couple and then took care of this lady ... all this with profesionalism ..... as far as im concerned i would always stay at thsi hotel and no other hotel gb florida

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: QuisProPrandium
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent - our room was the size of my office at work. Shockingly small. We offered a double bed or two twins - that was unexpected at a Best Western. The bathroom was the size of a boat water closet. You hit your elbows on the walls at the sink and there was barely room to turn around especially in the shower. If you are even slightly overweight or just big and tall avoid this place. I am not overweight and yet I had to turn sideways to get around the bed. The bed was comfortable and the A/C worked well. There is little help offered from the front desk but they will assist if asked. For the price, this is a poor value. Also, yes, there is still construction going on and several museums are closed or under renovation so this is a lousy time to visit Amsterdam as a tourist unless you are here only for the Red Light District only and smoking pot. In that case, you should stay closer to the Red Light District.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel - DON'T STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravelineurope
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Amsterdam with an extended Family. The ages in our group ranged from a 4 year old to an 80 year old. We booked 2 rooms online and paid the "advertised rate". The pictures shown online were really nice. When we got to the hotel, we were given 2 rooms which were completely different than shown online. The rooms were dirty, wth broken windows and smelled of urine. SEE PICTURES BELOW. When we complained to the staff we were told that at the price we were paying, those were the only rooms we would get. They would not fix or clean anything. DON'T BOOK THIS HOTEL ONLINE AND DON'T STAY HERE. You won't get the rooms that they show.

Reviews.Title: “Get your room cleaned early”
Reviews.Author: ingbing
Reviews.Content: The hotel room itself was nice but my main gripe is that on one day our room didn't get cleaned. True we were in room a fair bit but there were several hours when we were out, and had hung the "please make up our room" sign.The only response was to hang a bag with some clean towels in it on our door. When I asked at reception I was told that the cleaning staff had all left for the day- I have never experienced this in any other hotel I have stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, tiny little room, below average staff”
Reviews.Author: Canada_Scott12
Reviews.Content: The Apollo hotel was great for what we wanted - a place to sleep. It was clean, nice and walking distance to everything you would want to see in Amsterdam! However, our room was very small! But it was newly renovated and the bed was comfortable! The shower leaked and we had to put down towels to keep it from leaking into the room. Two computers with free internet in the lobby were a great bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Not What It Says On The Tin”
Reviews.Author: Whisker73
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay at this hotel. I booked a weekend for myself, my partner and two friends through the Best Western Website, which this hotel is a member of. The hotel does not offer the facilities that it says it does on the website e.g. no tea and coffee making facilities in the room, no iron / ironning board in the room, and it would not accept the confirmed rate, overcharging both parties by Euro60 plus tax. I have now taken this up with Best Western. There are other hotels in Amsterdam, Hotel Amsterdam is a particularly good one. Stay there. This hotel is a fraud.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Fab Hotel, Plenty to do Day and Night”
Reviews.Author: Lil09
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is ideal, only a short walk to the centre of the city - shops restaurants, bars ect. The hotel is up to date, clean and has friendly staff. Breakfasts are available fairly cheaply, are extensive and you can eat as much as you want - I would recommend. The hotel is ideal for any visit to Amsterdam, I came with my parents, my partner (both of us 18 years old) and his parents - we stayed for 4days/3nights. We were all more than happy with the hotel. There is plenty to do in Amsterdam - the Anne Frank House, Canal Cruises for tours ect, Museums, Shopping, Eating out, Drinking. (I would recommend visiting the Red Light District as a point of interest.) In Summer, the weather is fairly pleasant, similar to British. The Transport system of trams is efficient and effective. Although i would recommend sampling water transportation - bikes are also available. In order to make the most of your trip to Amsterdam, I would recommend doing a little research to find out what activities you may be interested in and what areas would prioritise in the short space of time you are there for - to maximise your break. I would definately go again, to the same hotel. There was nothing I disliked about the trip, it was all round really enjoyable. Some may argue that rooms are small, but that is what is to be expected in a small city such as Amsterdam. I would encourage security of your handbag and be aware to keep it safe at all times as in all cities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but small room”
Reviews.Author: SweTee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern and nicely decorated. We stayed in the new part of the hotel, where unfortunately there is no elevator up to the rooms (611 was our room) so we had to carry our luggage up the VERY steep stairs. The room was very small but clean and quiet and therefore served the purpose as we weren't staying for very long. The location is great, just by Vondelpark and on a quiet street and minutes away from the posh shopping street. I noticed that the hotel has an elevator for all other rooms so we were probably just unlucky.

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel in the right place”
Reviews.Author: chicken-chaser
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel in the right part of amsterdam. a 1 minute walk to the rijkmuseum and van gogh museum.the tram stops at the end of the road,tram line no.5.it's a 5 minute walk to the heineken experiance,which is very good.just across the canal are some good resturants,we had steak,thai and italian.the aran pub is well worth stopping at,if only to have a pint,with some great chicken wings and watch the world go by. the hotel is covered in scaffolding and there is a lot of work going on,although we were not disturbed by it.the top two floors were being refurbed.our room was a single with another bed put in it.space was a bit tight but you don't spend all day in your room.the works will go on till xmas at least.don't be put off though.see if you can get a flight and room deal through easyjet.we saved around Â£150 this way don't bother with breakfast,it's 15 euro each,go to where the tram stop is and there is a great big park with a cafe.they do ham and eggs and a good cuppa for a lot less. the i amsterdam card was worth getting and i think we broke even on it.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Parisitaly
Reviews.Content: I will start off by stating that the mistake was mine and mine alone. Meant to book this hotel for July and mistakenly made the reservation for June. The hotel's policy is to charge for one night, in my case, 100 euros for a no-show. I will take responsibility for this. Once I learned of the mistake, and unfortunately after the check-in date, I called the hotel (because US reservations can't do anything with international hotels) to try and reschedule while also getting a portion of the charge waived. The first time I called, the gentleman told me it was 2:00am and I had to call reservations when they arrived at 9:00am. I stayed up until midnight my time to call them back. The second time I was transferred to someone in reservations. After speaking to her she told me I had to speak with Gabby and needed to call back in another hour. I stayed up another hour and called back and spoke to Gabby. Gabby was by the book and said this is the policy of the hotel and she can't change that. I can't be mad at Gabby for enforcing the policy. But the fact remains that I still need to stay four nights in July and due to poor customer service and lack of foresight, they've lost my business now and in the future. So while they have $140 of my money, Best Western will never get another dollar from me on my domestic or international travel.

Reviews.Title: “BAD SERVICE! Renovations! Double-Charged!”
Reviews.Author: Lorikponchik
Reviews.Content: The only good thing going for this hotel is location; it is a few seconds away from most important museums. The service is beyond bad, they are totally unresponsive, smile to your face but do not do anything about what you ask. One night we had a waterfall in our room because of the rain outside, literally all night we had water falling from the ceiling. After reporting it to front desk, they said "others have the same problem", another words deal with it. The following night the fire alarm went off 3 times during the night - we barely slept and they could not fix it! Disaster! To top it all off, when I came home I noticed that they charged my credit card twice! Just total incompetence and negligence. There is also major construction ongoing at this time. I would not recommend this hotel! Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “great stay, pity about the noise”
Reviews.Author: theworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights early June. We got a newly refurbished room, very clean and modern, flat tv, new , but small tiled bathroom and mini bar. I knew before arriving there was building work taking place, easy to find hotel with the scaffolding on it!, our room was on the ground next to the scaffolding lift! 7am the workmen start and was unable to sleep after that - even with ear plugs in. The hotel is handy for the trams, bar and restaurnts of the Leidselein area, 2 mins to Vondelpark great in the summer. There's free internet in reception and free wifi so take your laptop, and free electronic safe in the room. I would stay again, but ask for internal rooms for now, should be quieter??

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Sunset71
Reviews.Content: It was a nightmare! I stayed at this hotel for three night. First of all, there is a lot of renovation causing troubles from very early in the morning. No sound proof at all. You can even listen other people outside the room. My room was literally a shoe box. No space for nothing, not even for putting my luggage on a table. the mattress was uncomfortable as the pillows were as well. It is a clear abuse the amount of money paid for such a poor room. I think for them the important thing is to show a nice face of the front part of the building and the lobby but they don't care about the internal rooms. I had to go to the reception several times not only to complaint about it but also to ask for towels, and other toiletries as the service was not good. Don't be impressed by the pictures shown as the rooms are not like they seem to be. Astrid/ United Kingdom

Reviews.Title: “Renovations alert”
Reviews.Author: Thecaldon
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at the Apollo Museum unless you like the sound of power equipment and hammering. There are major renovations on-going and the holtel staff will not offer any compensation for the inconvienence. The rooms are very small (8 feet x 12 feet!) and some are even at half-basement level. Good location but not good value for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location but ongoing renovation”
Reviews.Author: docer
Reviews.Content: We chose this after looking up many reviews on Amsterdam Hotels. Nice location but a few probs: we had booked through an online site so when we arrived we had a room infront of a big skip filled with rubbish. Very small bathroom- the frosted glass door is a constant feature with all the bathrooms. They did change us to a nice room with a view of the canal the next day (monday- they had free rooms). Please make sure but the surprise city tax and problems with your bill again seem to be a constant feature like previous reviews. Nice hotel -only if you have to stay 1-2nights.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of renovations!”
Reviews.Author: SmallPleasures1
Reviews.Content: This hotel would have been fine if it hadn't been under renovation. On the weekend when they weren't working it was fine but on week days the banging and noise that started early in the morning was a horrible way to start the day. The staff were very unapologetic and unsympathetic. No compensation was offered, not even a complimentary coffee or breakfast which I suggested. I also had a lot of difficulty changing my reservation the week before our arrival. My emails weren't responded to, when I called I was told there was only one person who could assist and she was never there and didn't call me back. Our room was so small that I had to put my suitcase on top of the desk as there was absolutely no space anywhere else. On a positive note the lobby and room were very classy and spotless clean. The location is fine, but their claim that you could not be more central is not accurate. They are on the far edge of all the places you would want to go, not in the middle which is what I would consider central. Be sure to ask if they're still under renovation before booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: chorleyk
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel it was fully scaffolded.The thought of an early 80s spanish building site ran through my mind, but once inside i was more than a little surprised. The lobby and check in area were very bright clean and modern, the staff very helpful and nothing was too much trouble. The room was excellent if a little on the small side, but this is pretty much the norm for big city european hotels unless you want to pay extortionate prices. The en suite was all marble tiles with fixtures of gleaming chrome so i presumed we had one of the renovated rooms. As for building noise we heard very little and there was no dust or mess inside the hotel. The hotel is very close to most entertainment, museums, hard rock cafe etc but far enough away so you dont get any noise. My only gripe is the same as most other reviewers; no coffee making facilities in the room. Fix that and its five stars all round.

Reviews.Title: “excelent”
Reviews.Author: jayshah51
Reviews.Content: It was a big surprise for me as I went to this hotel after about 20 years. It has totally changed. Ther are still old rooms but the full hotel is being renoveted. Excelent service . This is a pefect hotel for business as well as for tourists. Location, rooms ,service,internet every thing is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: msroni
Reviews.Content: just came back from amsterdam(wonderful city) stayed at this hotel..did not know what to expect but the hotel is fab. would of given it a 5 rating but there is no room service and coffee making facilities(they are refubrishing at the moment even though it was a bit noisy on the first day but then. for the rest of my stay it was quiet.) great location, quiet residential area but within walking distance to all transportation,food,cafe and so on.the staff was very friendly and helpful,room clean (although some people may have a bit of complaint about the bathroom being small but i did not mind and it was clean) if i am to visit amsterdam again would stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1492trip
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. One of the nicest areas in the city - very quiet, smart and respectable. From this location it is easy to walk to any area of Amsterdam, and there are also easy tramlines with a stop just outside of the hotel. This location is a haven from some of the seedier aspects of Amsterdam (e.g., the red light district). The hotel itself is smart and the rooms very nicely furnished, although the single rooms are very small indeed. The staff are friendly, although there was confusion with the bill (I had booked through an online travel agency which includes city tax, but the hotel was unaware of this).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: callmer911
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location being right next door to Rijksmuseum and just a 2 min walk to the Leidseplein (most exciting part of town). The hotel is in the middle of a renovation which would be my only complaint because if you want to sleep in on a weekday they start construction about 9 am. Impossible to sleep through! The rooms are VERY small compared to US standards but common for European countries. The room we stayed in (1st floor room 111) was remodeled recently and very clean. Was a little tight for two people though. The bathroom was also recently remodeled and very clean. Towels could use a little updating as they are small and not very soft. Staff was very friendly and always made us feel welcome. All in all we had a great experience not only at this hotel but in Holland as well!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location easy access to all amenities”
Reviews.Author: mistiroot
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five days and paid up front for the double room.. The room was not as expected as it had no coffee/tea making facilities/ kettle within the room. The room was cold and we had to remember to push the card down when we came back in to activate the heating which was fan assisted and made a lot of noise........... On departure when I gave back the keys I was told that I had a bill which was for taxes....... I was shocked and said this...... I had paid up front since the end of Jan 09 and refused to pay the extra taxes.......... When booking this should be made clear as it can be very difficult to end your stay on this note.....................

Reviews.Title: “An absolute pleasure, would highly recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: itsmemelissa
Reviews.Content: I read various poor reviews of this hotel and was really surprised when I arrived to a modern and clean hotel with very helpful and friendly staff. I stayed on the first floor which was recently renovated. The room was bright and clean with a marble style ensuite bathroom. The flatscreen TV had over 60 channels catering for all languages. The 24 hour reception staff were helpful in giving directions and advice on where to eat out/see etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: al381
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days and 2 nights in Amsterdam. The hotel is modern, clean, and attractive. Rooms are very small, but didn't spend much time in them anyway. Bathrooms are great. Good location to the museums and short walk to the rest of the city's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Not very pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: mikedlcr
Reviews.Content: On entering the hotel, the atmosphere is very nice. However, we were given a room in a building adjacent to the hotel proper (this second building was reached via the basement level of the hotel). The room looked very worn and old. The windows were extremely damp. There was mold all along the crevices of the windows. We were staying there in December 2008 and the only source of heat was a plug-in radiator that was not very adequate - the room felt very damp and cold. The bathroom was not pleasant either with mold between the tiles. It did not look clean at all. There was no safety deposit box in the room either. We were given another room when we complained about the mold. However, the attendant in the front desk wanted to charge us 20 Euros per night for the other room. The charge was later dropped after sending an email to the manager. The second room was really nice, however it was in the basement level and was very cold during the day (even if you turn up the heat). It only warmed up at night. The bathroom was clean but the floor was tile and literally ice cold if walking barefoot. So if you are planning on staying here bring a pair of flip-flops just in case. Also, beware of good room deals for this hotel because it probably means they will place you in the building next door. Personally, I would not recommend this hotel. This comes from someone who is not a complainer. I have stayed in many hostels in the past and I'm usually easily pleased. However, the state of the first room I was given was not Hotel quality and is probably worse than any hostel I have ever stayed in. Just be careful if booking with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the 4th Floor”
Reviews.Author: Banana53
Reviews.Content: I was on business in Amsterdam and arrived late in in the evening at the hotel to be allocated a room on the 4th floor. This area has clearly not undergone any renovation work. Both myself and my colleague found rooms that were cold, musty and generally dirty. There was mould on the walls and rat bait beneath my bed ( See pictures). We immediately complained as I have now seen other people say on this site and were told there were no available rooms that night to change us to. We left our cases at reception the next day and eventually we were allocated rooms that had been renovated to a more hygienic standard. We observed other poor guests the next day also complaining about their room allocation and it appears the hotel are using these filthy rooms as an overflow for guests instead of taking them from use. I would not recommend this hotel at all for this reason. Particularly if you are a lone traveller. There was no feeling of personal safety with an unlocked door to the street immediately outside the dreaded 4th floor rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Flashby
Reviews.Content: We arrived to our room disappointed to find the old room (see the TA pics from other poster). We asked if anything could be done since not at all what was expected. We were given breakfast the next morning for free and moved to a recently renovated room. No hassle, just done. Staff was extremely helpful and accomodating. They were friendly and very professional. Excellent job by the staff! Room was nice, very new and modern. Shower was a bit leaky on the floor but they do have the bathmat. The breakfast was okay, we didn't pay for it and didn't see paying 12E50 for it the rest of the stay. Great location as the newly opened Heineken Experience and some really good pubs and restaurants are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Fee2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a 3 night break at the Apollo Museum Hotel in October 08. We were very pleased with the hotel, yes the rooms were small - but on a City Break - there is no need for a big room as you are on the go the whole time anyway. The hotel was very modern and the staff were extremely helpful. The location is fantastic, right next to the Riks Museum and just round the corner from the Van Gogh Museum. Depending on if you like to walk or not - you can get to every major attraction on foot, failing that it is next to a tram stop and a canal boat stop - both of which can get you round the city. The tram is also very handy to get to and from the Train station. (get on Tram No 5 from outside the train station and that will get you to a 3 minute walk from the hotel - just ask on the tram for the Riks Museam stop and they'll tell you when to get off). Found the hotel quite pricey for breakfast so we walked into Leidseplein and there is a great breakfast place called the Sports Bar which is very popular & reasonably priced. Does fantastic pancakes ! All in all - would recommend this hotel to anyone going for a few nights in Amsterdam - any longer than a few nights you may want to either book one of the suites as they are bigger, or find a hotel with larger rooms - but certainly for city breaks - we couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: melat165
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. The rooms had been refurbished and were small but clean with nice clean bathrooms. Close to museums, resturants and a tram stop. The staff was friendly and when we ended up getting stuck in Amsterdam an extra day due to a train strike we went back to this hotel for our extra night. They have a locked room behind the desk to keep your luggage if you arrive before check in time. They also have a few computers in the lobby for free internet access and they have free wireless access. We had read reviews that the breakfast was not worth the price so we did not try their resturant. There were plenty of places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: meandhimself
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a visit to Amsterdam (great city once you get used to the bikes -my advice... If you cant beat 'em join 'em!) We searched for ever on the internet for accommodation which was suprisingly difficult as everything was either fully booked or given terrible reviews on this site. I have to say though this hotel was great. Sure the room was tiny - but I take that as normal for Amsterdam - and if like us you are on a short visit and plan to spend most of your time out sightseeing all you want is a clean room, private bathroom and comfy bed and that is exactly what we got. The staff where pleasant and we had no problems at all. It is also in a great location - close to many museums and canals and tram lines which have to be the easiest way to get around and see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richbayl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as I was attending a conference at th RAI. It was a good location and was on a tram route that took me to the RAI. The room was a little on the small side, but the quality was good.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected, Great Locatiion”
Reviews.Author: lpduggan
Reviews.Content: I was pretty nervous about this stay because of some of the negative reviews I have read on TripAdvisor. I was pleasantly surprised! The hotel has been recently refurbished. From what I could tell in the reviews a refurbished room differed dramatically from one that hadn't been refurbished. From what I understand from the front desk, they have only 1 floor that isn't finished yet, and will be done soon. My room was 1 floor below the lobby, but it had windows, etc...The room is definitely small, as is the bathroom, but clean and comfortable. Free Wireless, Flatscreen TV, phone, etc... I wouldn't want to spend a ton of time in the room, but as a reasonably priced room, the location can't be beat. around the corner from musuems, walking distance to everything and 1 block from trams if you want to go far.

Reviews.Title: “Far from lovely”
Reviews.Author: RichardSE1
Reviews.Content: The lovely Bilderberg was fully booked on my recent trip to Amsterdam so I booked into the Apollo, which is handy for the office where I'm working. Suffice to say I will do my best to get back into the Bilderberg when I come back to Amsterdam in a few weeks. My basement room at the Apollo was tiny, and the walk-in shower smelt of bad drains. The supply of towels and toilet paper was sporadic. The furniture and furnishings are dark brown, tatty and depressing. Worst of all, I could feel every single spring in the mattress. In its defence, the Apollo's staff were friendly and helpful, the location is fantastic and (can't imagine why previous reviewers complain about this) there is no shortage of bars and restaurants nearby. But those plus points wouldn't persuade me to come back...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Doubledeckerbus
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very friendly staff, excellent breakfast, nice, comfortable bedrooms. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great and Modern”
Reviews.Author: SandLCook
Reviews.Content: You never know what you are going to get in a big city but this hotel did not disappoint. Modern and funky, great location and excellent well decorated rooms. As a suggestion, don't miss the BOLS experience just around the corner opposite Van Gogh museum.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Staff make it all worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: HUHoney60
Reviews.Content: TripAdvisor is right again! The location is fantastic for walkers and transport-lovers alike. The price is perfect for business or leisure travelers on a budget. The hotel claims it has finished its renovations, but readily admits (when prompted) that it is behind schedule. Regardless, I never heard a peep of construction or city noise. The multilingual staff save this otherwise lackluster hotel. They pay attention to guests and get to know you personally, including your tourism requests, preferred wake-up times - and especially your language. They are calm in a crisis and cheerful in the morning. Breakfast is filling, but absolutely not worth the price. HOWEVER, there is NOWHERE to eat near the hotel either obviously and/or open at convenient times, so if you have a big day planned, the breakfast can then be worth it (and sandwiches made for lunch!). Reserve AT LEAST a Classic Room, refuse to sleep in the basement, and plan that the rooms will be small with no drawer space.

Reviews.Title: “The best location in Amsterdam at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: mapiz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Apollo with my wife for two nights and it was great. The rooms are a little small but very clean and very modern. I read previuos reiviews and I have to contradict the people who said the rooms were not clean. The staff was always very friendly and outgoing. If i go back to Amsterdam this shall be my hotel once again.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: teel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and tidy although the rooms rather small and I faced the plant area at the back of the hotel on the first floor. This was not really an issue as uou don't spend all day staring out of the window! The staff were very friendly and helpful especially as I use a wheelchailr and they had to let us out in the goods lift whenever we wanted tocome in or go out. It is always worth asking for help and a hidden lift as you could not really see the lift from the outside until you were aware of it. Location was excellant, right next door to to the RIJKS MUSEUM and just a road to cross to the canal. Breakfast was a full hot and cold buffet...plenty of choice. Lots of nearby restaurants of international cuisine to eat in...the best Chinese is the floating SEA PALACE CHINESE RESTAURANT...a must for all Chinese foodies!! I would recommend the hotel and go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough room to swing a cat!”
Reviews.Author: kath79
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a really nice area of Amsterdam near to the Rijks Museum. There are many nice bars, restaurants and art galleries close by. It's also only 5 minute walk to the Leidsesplein. If you're travelling with children it's really well located - away from the red light district and sex shops. You can get the number 2 or 5 tram from Centraal station which takes only 5 minutes - alternatively, we walked around the centre most days! As for the rooms....we had room number 7 when we first arrived. It was awful. The room was tiny and the view was of an old building/dumping site with exposed pipes - urgh! The bathroom was miniscule and there was a horrible smell coming from the drains. The only plus side was that the air conditioning worked quite well and the bed was quite comfy. On a positive note, we asked to be moved and the hotel staff were very obliging and moved us to a slighly bigger room when one became available. (room 212). We had a wonderful view of the museum and canal from this room. The reception area of the hotel is very nice and modern and you can use free internet access in the lobby. I enjoyed my stay but I don't think that we'd chose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: naturewoman
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter, niece and I stayed here for 2 nights this past April. I had booked 2 'classic' rooms months ago for under a $100US total for each room. I was pleasantly surprised that the rooms were ok, the lobby staff helpful and location great. Yes the rooms were small and the rug had a few stains but would I stay there again? Yes...the price was right, the location great, and I felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at the Apollo Museum Hotel, small, unhygenic rooms & bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: ever8
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here. The rooms are tiny, we had to ask for a new room three times because they felt like prison cells. The bathrooms are a joke, very modern etc, but miniscule, one person can just about fit in. But all of that would have been ok had I not come home covered in bedbug bites!! I now have to go through the process of clearing out my own house to make sure I've got rid of them. This makes me feel disgusting and I am very angry at the hotel as it was obvious they didn't have very high standards. AVOID. Amsterdam is gorgeous though and this hotel is in a very good location, but that's about all it has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “dirt hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Constantine808
Reviews.Content: This is the filtiest hotel i have ever stayed at in my whole life. first off we got there and the lobby was like a constuction site. Then when we got to our room we were disgusted i wanted to check out there and then!, the carpets and walls were visibly black with dirt, the floor was on slant, a broken T.V., ensuite in the midle of the room that didnt close and the floor was on a slant!!!...we spent an hour in the room until i noticed that some previous guest has kindly picked their nose and wiped it on the wall. I promptly made my way to reception via the death trap of an elevator and gave notice that i was cutting my stay by 3 nights. The receptionist very was rude and did not appolgise for my inconvenience. DONT WASTE YOUR TIME OR YOUR MONEY!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Around_the_World65
Reviews.Content: Apollo Museum Hotel - as it's now called - is a completely refurbished, modern, non-smoking hotel with excellent location by the Singel canal on the corner of the posh P.C. Hooftstraat and Stadhouderkade. The reception is bright and spacious, so is the restaurant. Our Classic double room on second floor had two very comfortable single beds, a writing desk, air-conditioning and a wall-hung LCD-TV. The bathroom was impeccable and extremely clean with everything shining. The shower was great and brand new. I've noticed on various sites that there are rooms described as "Economy rooms", these are located on lower ground floor and are smaller than the Classic rooms. If you don't mind having a view only of peoples feet on the pavement outside this can be a budget choice. However, if you request more space and a nicer view I would definitely recommend you spend a few Euros extra and get a Classic room. At 17.95 Euros the breakfast seems a bit pricy. However, if you book your breakfast at the reception on the night before, you get a 5 Euro discount and pay only 12.95 Euro. That is actually priceworthy - the breakfast is buffet style and lacks nothing. You can eat as much as you like of eggs (boiled and fried), bacon, cereals, bread rolls, fruit juices, freshly made croissants, ham, cheese, fresh fruit and coffee or tea. The restaurant is open all day and quite nice to relax and enjoy a drink in while watching the boats on the canal outside the window. The only thing I can think of commenting on was the fact that it said that all Classic rooms have a mini bar. Ours didn't, but we never even bothered to ask why. Besides that very minor "problem" I consider Apollo Museum Hotel to be an excellent choice if you look for a clean and fresh hotel in the middle of everything.
