Leidseplein and numerous restaurants and bars are reached by a 5 min walk, Blue Boats departure (you must take a 75 min canal cruise) is just outside the hotel. The tram (#2 and 5 both go to the Centraal Station which takes about 7 mins) stops just around the corner on Hobbermaasstraat and takes 1 min to reach. The area is quiet and nice though it's close to everything. For those travelling with children: this is an area free from all kinds of sex shops - not to be forgotten. Last but not least - if you go to the left when you go out of the hotel, just around the corner there is an Indonesian restaurant called Srikandi. Try their Rijsttaffel, an Indonesian smÃ¶rgÃ¥sbord which is marvellous. I have never met such polite and nice waiters before, and the food was delicious. Enjoy your stay in this lovely city!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Gosport
Reviews.Content: Im not sure if I have selected the right location but the hotel I am reviewing on is Museum Hotel Amsterdam in PC Hooftstraat . Anyway, we came here in May 2007. It had work being done to it, which was never stated anywhere when we booked. But it was not a problem. The staff were great, the rooms were so clean and lovely. The room I had wasnt very spacious but was very nice. The location was excellent, there is a tram stop right near the hotel and takes about 5mins into the centre, you could even walk it, its not that far. In the next street was some designer shops like Gucci, Louis Vuitton and a few more. My favourite bit!! But for the money I paid, it was an excellent stay. I recomend this to anyone. I havent been since the work has been done to it, but I will defnatly be back this year to see it. We got a taxi to the hotel from the airport, but cant remember how much it was, and got a train back to the airport, and again cant remember how much. Im sure it wasnt alot. Basically everything is in walking distance from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Business stay”
Reviews.Author: AlMan42
Reviews.Content: I stayed here near the end of January on two separate occasions. The rooms I had were nice and the hotel is in a great location...not in an overly crowded area but close enough to walk to a lot of restaurants, cafes and other sights. The price was very reasonable compared to other hotels in the area and the staff were friendly and helpful. I only have some slightly negative feedback. The first was that the free internet provided was sporadic. It was down quite a lot while I was there but it never slowed me down too much. I was there on business and I lucked out as when I needed it, it was functioning for the most part. When it was working it was a speedy connection....a colleague stayed at another hotel nearby and they were charging 20 Euros a day for a connection, so it's hard to really complain about it. I had to break up my stay for a side trip that came up, so this may have left to some confusion about my bill but there were charges for breakfast on my bill and mini bar items that I never had. I informed the staff and they quickly took it off the bill though however. There just might be some slight disorganization there.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Foster44
Reviews.Content: The Museum hotel is excellent. I went with my wife for a three night break and can recommend this hotel. It's located at the bottom of the centre of Amsterdam right by the hard rock cafe, Holland casino and two of the major museums. Everything is within walking distance or the trams run every couple of minutes. To get to the hotel from the airport, catch a train to Amsterdam Centraal station (3 euros 60 each), then catch tram number 5 down to the Riks museum just after the Marriot hotel. The hotel room was small, but very clean with a great shower. The bar area is nice and staff friendly and there's currently 30% off in the restaurant. I recommend this hotel for anyone staying in the heart of Amsterdam. Riks museum, Van Gogh museum, shopping for the well known (expensive) brands - all close by. Plenty of restaurants and bars close by, with cuisine from all over the world.

Reviews.Title: “Brown!”
Reviews.Author: Brizzle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MH at the end of August '07. We booked a 'deluxe' room as we wanted to splash out a bit for a long weekend away. But, we were disappointed with our renovated room. I know hotels in Amsterdam are expensive and rooms tend to be small, but this was really small. There was no desk or table or chair and barely any floorspace. Cat swinging would have been difficult. The hotel has recently been renovated, very much with a brown theme, which makes the rooms seem even smaller. They have obviously cut corners in doing this, as although it looks quite nice the fittings were not of very good quality and the bed was awful - very soft and two great canyons on each side where other people had slept. It was as if they didn't replace the beds when renovating. There was still some building work going on when we stayed, but it was pretty much finished so we didn't experience any noise. The bathroom was also small and was very impractical as whenever you had a shower (there wasn't a bath) water escaped from the cubicle and went all over the floor. We had colleagues staying in other rooms and they too had the same problem. Whilst we were checking in/out there were other people demanding new rooms or arguing about price/service, although the staff were quite nice and tried to help - although they did send us across Amsterdam to a pancake restaurant that was shut! I'd add that the breakfast is not included in the price, but for what it is I'd go elsewhere. The location is good as you're not right in the middle of seedy tourist land, but overall if I go to Amsterdam again I'll try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: telco
Reviews.Content: I had the privilege of staying at the Museum during the height of their repairs, when there was dust and construction all around, in fact the weekend I was there, one could walk in off the street and walk up a staircase to the rooms, without even seeing the reception desk. The room was clean, but it was tiny. But at 90E for a weekend night, unbelievably cheap. But, there was dust and debris and bags of something in the hallways, but... 90Euro. If you can get a rate, and don't mind anything other than the inside of your room, the location can't be beat. If you are even somewhat sensitive to 'atmosphere', I would stay as far away as possible. Of course, this is all before the repairs are finished, then who knows?

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: abruls
Reviews.Content: I had some friends over from abroad and had them stay in the museum hotel. I checked out the rooms before booking. There are two kind of rooms in this hotel. First the "classic" rooms which were clean but could use a serious refurbishment, these are cheaper though. Second the recently renovated rooms which I booked, these rooms are what you would expect. The size of the rooms are what is normal in Amsterdam, not so large but for the rest everything was fine, no complaints what so ever. The staff were really helpful and professional. The lady that helped my friends spoke Spanish fluently. I was witness of a unsatisfied customer who really was out of line, jelling and screaming in the lobby . The staff stayed calm and handled the situation. What patience!! The best reason to stay at this hotel is the location. It's just a hundred metres from centre of the city and even closer to all the museums. Last but not least the bar and restaurant are fine as well, the bar was actually quite pleasant to have a few drinks before hitting the nightlife. I spoke with the staff, next year all rooms will be modernised.

Reviews.Title: “Needs work”
Reviews.Author: mdeighan
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The location can not be beat, as it is so close to walk to museums, food and tourist sites. But the place is really suffering through the renovations. Our room was mostly clean and they kept the loud construction noise to decent hours. Try to negotiate a lower price with the hotel directly. When it is finished this place will be fabulous and probably very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Shauniec
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the museum hotel for two nights in august and did not have a positive experience. The hotel is undergoing renovations and the reception and restraunt were very nice and stylish but the room was a different story. The hotel room was TINY, barely enough room for two people to move around in. The walls had peeling paint and there was mould on the the walls of the bathroom and the bedroom area. Generally the hotel room was terrible and even though the room was cheap, it was very basic by any standards The hotel is a nice area of amsterdam and it is an easy walk to the major shopping areas and restraunts. The hotel may be a good place to stay once the renovations are completed but until then I think your money would be better spent at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We had mice in our room”
Reviews.Author: Mitcham07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Museum Hotel this month which started our trip around Europe. Words can't describe how disappointed we were with this hotel. Firstly we were given room 301. The worst hotel room I have ever stayed in, which had a sink in the bedroom as the bathroom was too small, mould through out the whole room and especially thick in the bathroom. Clearly the room had previously been broken into as the lock was broken. We then asked for another room which was also on the third floor, this room was marginally better (if that is possible) only to find a mouse in our room at 2:00am. This hotel is currently under renovation and only the first two floors out of the three have been completed. If you do want to stay here dont accept a room on the third floor. All I can say is DO NOT STAY HERE. The staff were also quite unfriendly and unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Our classic room was a dump!”
Reviews.Author: imonlyhuman
Reviews.Content: Posted: 2-Sep-07 This place was a dump! This is a hotel of two parts. I booked a "classic" double room which was only accessible by going outside from the lovely refurbished foyer and down the road to another entrance where the electric mains cable ran through the letterbox and the bags of dirty linen were dumped on the tatty carpet in the hallway. The room (405)was so small that there was no room either side of the bed. Along the wall near the window was growing black mould and because of the tightness of the bed to the wall, presumably they were unable to clean the dirt from the around the radiators. A wall light and desklight did not function. There was mould on the shower room ceiling (no bath) and after the first night the towels were not changed or the rubbish bin emptied! There didnâ€™t seem to be any fire escapes and the only provision I saw was a fire hose on the wall and an escape route plan. (Not much help to those on the higher floors) Why didnâ€™t I ask to be moved? Because it was reasonably quiet in there (a priority) and the bed was comfortable. Other than that I donâ€™t know how they can use the word "classic". They say you get what you pay for and we didnâ€™t even get that. For a higher rate you can get a "deluxe room" which is accessible by lift and newly refurbished. The difference couldnâ€™t be more contrasting. I also booked a roundtrip airport shuttle with Connexion. Their airport desk instructed me to give my departure time to the Hotel reception who would ring them and arrange the return journey. No way! They wouldn't ring - they sent me down the Road to another Hotel (not related) who kindly rang and we arranged pickup from there.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare dump doesnt ever cover it”
Reviews.Author: Notimpressed75
Reviews.Content: Total unmitigated disaster. Mould, holes in walls, cigarette butts IN BATHROOM, broken windows, peeling walls. Reception had the audacity to say that these things happen and that many hostels were like this for backpackers and they dont complain!! i backpacked for a year in AFRICA and ASIA and never stayed somewhere so rubbish and I sure as hell didnt pay Â£70 a night for it. DO NOT GIVE THIS HOTEL YOUR MONEY

Reviews.Title: “Pay only cash, do not give your credit card details”
Reviews.Author: Chickeen
Reviews.Content: My friend booked this hotel from Germany through internet. I visit the Museum Hotel website and did not notice any warning about on going refurbisment. My friend had noticed from the booking companys webpage at least he knew that this was the case. Hotel rooms were nice but nothing else not. 7am in the morning they started banging, talking...We had 2 twin room booked for 4 person and we have given creditcard details in good faith for the hotel to reserve these hotel rooms. As I was first person to leave early in the morning I paid one room with my credit card night before. I left receipt of the payment to my friend as proof that one room is already paid when they check out later next morning. When my credit card bill arrived to uk Museum Hotel had charged hole stay twice in 2 seperate days. So there was no error that some how same day I would be charge in mistake twice. As well my friend in Germany had same problem his card was charge twice. Totally Museum Hotel charge us 4 rooms 3 nights!!!!! I have not received any appologies from the hotel!!! Keep good care of your credit cards pay just only with cash if you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “What a disaster”
Reviews.Author: tig_b
Reviews.Content: We stayed 25-27 June. I wish I'd read some of the other reviews here first and cancelled. There was no lounge, restaurant or bar - just a small vending machine with crisps and chocolate in the middle of a building site. Nothing available to drink, not even water. There were electric cables across the floor, and sometimes dangling at head height as well. There was builders rubble and dust everywhere. On day two they knocked a large hole in the outside wall of our corridor, on the 3rd floor, leaving an exposed drop to the ground which was blocked off by laundry trolleys at night. And they blocked the lift access with a scaffold for part of the day. Day three they started work outside my window at 07.40. The staff were rude - obviously fed up with the complaints and clearly not interested in solving any problems or apologising.

Reviews.Title: “Where was Basil Fawlty?”
Reviews.Author: City_TripperUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights 13th -16th June '07. We were really disappointed. The Hotel is under heavy refurbishment, something that our booking agent failed to tell us. Workmen are on site Monday to Friday and although the Hotel state that they don't start work until 9.00 am we had workman outside our room from 8.00 am. The Management also posted a daily letter requesting that we didn't use the water between certain times of the day. The hotel has no refreshments on site, except for a snack vending machine (but no drinks!), breakfast is served in the Park Hotel next door. We were given a 'deluxe' room which was nicely fitted, but small and we had to have the curtains drawn during the day because of the workman working outside our window The Hotel is in an good location near to Leidseplein, restaurants and designer shops, but would seriously advise that you don't go until the refurbishment work is finished.

Reviews.Title: “only if you're desperate!!”
Reviews.Author: staffstraveller15
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews I was a little concerned about the hotel before arriving. I should have listened to my instincts! It looks closed from the outside, the scaffolding has gone, but the building is still filthy and massively knocked about. There are dustsheets everywhere covering the interior, paper over a new marble floor in the foyer, generally a very poor first impression. The staff seem pleasant, although take proof of your booking, we were told that breakfast wasn't included for expedia guests, luckily our confirmation email said that it did. You do need to go along the road to a different hotel for excellent buffet style breakfast. We were given one of the refurbished rooms, just as pictured on the website, but perhaps using trick photography!! Quite possibly the smallest double room I've ever been in, you are able to walk round the bed, but there was only about a foot to spare at the bottom. No bedside cabinets or lamps, but the most inappropriately large desk you've ever seen, no chair though! The ensuite was very nice, everything you need, but very snug with a glass door into the bedroom. The air conditioning worked and was needed, it was very warm overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Artful Deception”
Reviews.Author: Vegas-Chris
Reviews.Content: Despite the previous reviews and the warning when booking, I was still surprised by the level of construction taking place in the hotel. I arrived to absolute chaos. I honestly didnâ€™t mind as I was out during the day. What I did mind was the additional fees/expenses that were suddenly added to my final bill. Let me elaborate. There was a sign prominently posted at the reception counter. It stated something to the effect that you were to obtain your â€œbreakfast voucherâ€� and take it to the Park Hotel and that they were very sorry for any inconvenience this may cause. What they neglected to state was this breakfast was NOT included in the price of your room and cost 15 euro/day. So in essence what might have been a good deal on a room went down the drain as I am sure the average couple could have found a hotel that included breakfast and had no construction for that additional 30 euro/day. If you still want to stay here, skip the park hotel breakfast and have a traditional English breakfast practically anywhere in town for about 5 euro. Otherwise I found the hotel to be of standard European fare. The room was a bit small and you could hear your neighbors as well as you could if they were in the same bed with you. It appears they are converting all the rooms to ensuite. In order to accomplish this they are adding 4â€™ X 4â€™ (1.2 meters X 1.2 meters) bathrooms to each room. While it looks very euro-chic, it isnâ€™t very practical for more than a day or two nor for more than one person. Pro-the hotel is located in a very nice area with museums and upscale shops (think louis vuitton)

Reviews.Title: “Worst "Hotel" Ever”
Reviews.Author: RJM0
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I have ever stayed in. We were not told about the construction, the windows didn't open in the room (which was very hot and did not, as the website indicates, have air conditioning - the website also claims there is a mini bar etc which, given the state of the rooms, is laughable), the water was turned off without warning from 11am until 3pm one day, no key was available for the room on arrival and our room wasn't actually even in the hotel - we had to go out the front door and go in another door down the road. Terrible "hotel" - it's more like a collection of dodgy bedsits.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever been to”
Reviews.Author: rosa80
Reviews.Content: First I have to say that nobody (not even our travel agent!) informed us about the construction works at the hotel. In fact I was shocked when we entered that dirty, noisy so called 3star hotel. First thing we experienced was that the staff tried to give us an awful room in part of the hotel which was under heavy construction. I immediately insisted on a refurbished room which we got at least. But even the refurbished room was cold, noisy with a lot of ants in it. The only good things about this hotel are the location and breakfast. If you like nois, dirty and ants in your bed i realy recommend this hotel to you! :-) Birgit

HotelInfo.Name: Apollo Museum Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 2 P C Hooftstraat, Amsterdam 1071BX, The Netherlands
